text: Said they would be to pick my car up in 15 minutes over 2 hours later still no show roadside hadto call someone else very very unprofessional

text: If you are unfortunate to need a tow or a jump, call McAdams.  They answered the call, showed up quickly, and got us jumped off so that we could get a battery.  Best in the Orange Beach area.

name: lauren rollin
text: I had my insurance company make the call to McAdams towing, I waited over two hours without hearing a word on where John was. I had a lady call me and tell me that john had been trying to call me numerous times but I had not one missed call from him. I had a voicemail left and called John back, when he answered he told me how he called me 8 times and how I never answered him, also said when he would call that I would answer the phone and hang up- I told him I never had one missed call only  voicemail left and how I had been waiting over two hours to hear something or for him to show up- which he interrupted me saying he tried to call me and I never answered- he also told me how close he was to my house but since I never answered my phone he decided to go to another location. He was very rude and unprofessional. After we got off the phone he decided to not even come back to pick up my car. He never called me back to tell me- I had to end up calling my insurance company and ask where he was because another hour had passed. I will tell whoever ask me about a towing company to not use them.

name: Hayley Kler
text: This place is SHADY!!!  Avoid it!  My car was towed, and they came up with any excuse to not give it back, they lied and made up excuses.  No doubt taking kick backs from the city by the looks of their facility.  White trash.

text: Billy, the driver is the most amazing person. You do not find people like this anymore! He not only came to jump my car off, but went with me to get my battery to make sure I was safe, and even offered to put it in if the store wouldn’t... and to top off the customer service, he followed up with me to make sure I was ok and safe... MAKE SURE YOU REQUEST BILLY TO BE YOUR DRIVER, YOUR EXPECTATIONS WILL BE EXCETED!

name: Bama Beach
text: I'd say it's pretty hard to get a good review if you're towing off illegally parked cars.... I get it. My issue is being provided information on the yard location (and great, clear directions at that) and not being told once that the driver would require only cash for payment. Yup, $300 CASH! The driver said she tried to tell you on the phone, so I'm like ok, my bad, I'll have to listen to that recorded call in a bit. No, NO mention that the driver would only be accepting cash.... just, yes, we have the car, clear directions on its location, driver will meet you there and is on his way and have a good day! Not like you have a choice on who tows your car off when you're in the wrong..... not when you do have a choice, may I recommend Itty Bitty's.... heck a portion of their extravagant bill goes to Breast Cancer Awareness.... that's gotta be worth something!

text: My car got stuck in the sand off Fort Morgan road ( I think it's called Broken Road) and after digging and trying to get it out ourselves I finally gave up and called this company. They had a guy on his way in 10mins driving from OB so he got to us in around another 40mins. He went above and beyond to help, it was a pretty tricky situation because of the horrible road conditions but after about 40 more minutes of hard work we did it! I absolutely recommend! The lady on the phone and the driver were both very sweet and polite. I was charged $165 and I tipped $15 ( I really really hope that was enough). Thank you so much!

name: Holley Hartdegen
text: Horrible customer service! My dad has driven tow trucks for over 15 years and when he went to pickup his car.... he noticed that the frame was bent! The tow trucker driver admitted to seeing the damage. When I went to question the owner's wife about it, she basically told me to to get the "f" out of her yard and proceeded to yell and scream at me! I am calling ever condominium places that uses their service to let her know how horrible my experience was! No owner of a business should ever to speak a customer like this!

resp.text: Holley was not the owner of the car. She had no right to be on the property. After telling her Father that we had video of the car been loaded and were willing to show it to him he declined, because in order to show him the video we needed to get the security company of the condominium where they were staying to show it to him and needed to get the Police involved. He made a quick decision to sign the release form and drive his car away. Holley was down right rude cursing like sailor a trying to start a fight. Her boyfriend was the one that grabbed her and stopped any physical altercations. We knew they were going to trouble before they even got there from the phone calls the night before asking about their car. Their car was towed because they had 1 parking pass for 3 cars. They knew that 2 of their cars were parked illegally. We only tow cars that the security company asks us to tow and because of what can happen they video the car been loaded as proof that it was loaded correctly.

name: Jay Jernigan
text:
First of all, put a negative sign in front of that star up there & you begin to understand my point. Mr. Usry signed a written contract with me for a set monetary value & so far has refused to make any attempt to honor it. He has had ample time & been offered a few different options for payment, yet he refuses. If his signature is worthless, then I'm sure his word is too. I'll admit that I saw him put a clutch in his own pickup truck, & he swapped engines in a friend's,(which is still running) but my only example of his work is a Harley Davidson that he slopped together. Bad starter, sticking brakes, poor workmanship through out. I'm warning you because I wish someone had warned me: I wouldn't let this guy touch a bicycle, much less a motor vehicle !!!!
Edit:10-11-16 For now, this post will stay. It is the truth. I tried to help this guy out, he ripped me off; it's as simple as that. He can fix this, or remain a charlatan, his choice. I will gladly remove this review the minute Thad Usry proves to be an honest man.
Update:6-09-17. Still no joy from this boy. I will concede that he probably earned that one good review where he had to work in a storm, but the one posted by his girlfriend, Jackie,(who could not even spell my name right with it written before her) is totally biased. You ain't fooling anybody, period.

name: Yvette G
text: Horrible experience. Went in for something super simple and can put with an even bigger problem. I purchased a windshield wiper arm. It was confirmed that the arm was for the year and make of my car. I asked if I could pay extra for him to put it on and he agreed. He wasn't able to put it on claiming that it was becuase I needed a nut. I noticed that the wipers were no longer working after he tried putting it on. He claimed the wiper motor was not working. The wiper motor was working completely fine prior to him touching my car. I took it to my trusted mechanic and it was confirmed that not only did the wiper arm Hammett sold me was NOT for my year and make car, but he also tore my wiper transmission when he ripped the arm off of it. Prior to me even going to Hammett, I took it by my mechanic to confirm what was needed. It was confirmed that I only needed the arm as the wiper motor and wiper transmission were perfectly fine in great condition, I had also driven the car in the rain the day before and the wiper worked just fine. I called and text  the guy who damaged the car and sent photos and I have yet to receive a response. Do not only did i pay $40 for an arm that doesn't fit my car (Oriellys Auto Parts confirmed that the Hammett arm was likely for a 2003 not a 2008), but I also had to pay $75 for the part Hammett broke as well as $75 for a brand new arm from The dealership. This was a $40 fix that ended up costing me $190! This is a real review. I would not suggest taking your car or buying any parts from this company. The honest thing to do would have been to at the very LEAST reimburse me for the arm that didn't fit the car. I gave them that opportunity by calling and texting prior to this review and I didn't receive any response back.

name: Turnt Raw
text: Scott came to my rescue late one evening after a tornado struck Maplesville where I was just so unfortunate to be at the time. He towed my company's truck to his yard, got me to a hotel and got me a ride to get a rental the next day. He and his crew were always very kind and courteous, even to the point of giving me a hand at packing all of my personal belongings out of the wrecked truck. He allowed us to use their yard to switch our trucks and trailers around and even loaded the wrecked truck on our trailer so my company could haul it home. These are good, hard working individuals who make up the Mims Team. I cannot thank them enough for their hospitality in our time of struggle. Thank You all again for all of your help and kindness!

name: Queen Lydlid
text:
Mims towing saved us!!
After over 30 hours broke down in the entrance ramp of a rest area on the phone with AAA who couldn't find a tow for our RV. I called Mims and they picked us up and towed us almost an hour away to Motgomery AL to a repair shop. Scott was talking to me through text and calls trying to help us troubleshoot our problem while trying to help us find a mobile repair shop to possibly get us fixed and on a Sunday no less. The over all help and support we got from Mims was amazing and well beyond what they had to do. If I ever break down in AL agian they they are going to be my first call. Their service was more then 10 stars worth. If there was a way to give them a better review I would do it. Thank goodness Mims exists or we might still be sitting in that entrance ramp.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! So happy we could provide you guys with the service you needed! Hopefully y’all will never be stuck in a rest area again, but happy to know that we will be your first call! Best of luck to y’all! God Bless!

name: Jay Cameli
text: Can’t thank Scott and his crew enough for getting us home! If you ever need a service give them a call you won’t be disappointed!

resp.text: You guys are so welcome! Thank you for your kind words! We are glad we could be of service!

name: Greg Parker
text: I had problems with my truck, called MIMS WRECKERS at 10 am and I was in prattville, they got to me at 10:40 am and get me towed to there yard and gave me a ride home, they call me at 4:30 pm that evening already have my truck tore apart and tell me my transmission was gone and said I would have about the same in to rebuild vs getting a new one, 5 business days later they have me a new transmission and everything is good, wasn’t even there a full week, highly recommend them. Thanks MIMS!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words! It was a pleasure to work with you! Please let us know if we can help you with anything in the future!!

text: They were amazing, they came to our rescue when we broke down and helped us beyond our relief. Helped us with a new battery and more. We were stuck at our halfway point and offered to bring us back to TN or destination MS. But they fixed our truck and MS we went. If im ever around this area again with traveling and having problems i know who to call, Derrick was terrific.  I highly recommend them!

name: Darrick Dunlap
text:
PLEASE READ!!!!!!!!!
Great people we were broke down on i65 for over 4 hours in 90 degree heat with 3 kids and an aldot worker, Josh Matthews, stopped and stayed with us also called MIMS Towing for us because our road side service couldn't. MIMS TOWING  came within an hour with a tow truck and flat bed and towed our f250 and camper and also had us a spot to camp at before they even got to us. We are from Ohio and they made sure our truck got to Johnny's truck repair and took me my wife and our 3 kids to the campground with our camper. Thank you mims towing we would probably still be sitting on i65 with our kids. Great company everyone should call them. THEY SAVED US FOR SURE!!! Thank you Scott and Derrick.

name: Jeri King
text: MUST READ REVIEW! Would it be an exaggeration to say Mims Wrecker Service saved our lives? My husband and I think it's an accurate statement. Stranded on I-65 on a Sunday in over 90 degree heat with nearly dead phones, we waited nearly 3 hours because our insurance company (who we already paid to tow us over 100 miles) assured us that help was on the way. It wasn't. With vehicles whizzing past so closely that our car would rock and the battery so dead that the hazard lights stopped flashing, we decided to google tow trucks near us and Mims popped up with a 5-star rating and very close. Even though it was Sunday, the owner, Scott, answered our prayers and arrived in less than 15 minutes to haul us somewhere safe. One of his drivers volunteered to work on Sunday to tow us home. Thank you, Derrick. I should also mention that Mims price was $120 cheaper than what the insurance company charged. We HIGHLY recommend Mims Wrecker Service! Very Professional! Very Courteous! Possibly saved our lives and definitely saved our wallets!

name: Barry Wiginton
text: I had a blow out today on the I-65 and was able to get to one of the Clanton exits. A repair truck was to me in less than 4 minutes and the young was very friendly and changed my tire in a matter of minutes. I would highly recommend using this company if in or traveling through Clanton. Thanks for getting me back on the road, Mims!!!!

name: Kaysen Eli
text: I have used this company several times. They are always really great. They respond very quickly and the people are really nice and respectful and helpful.

name: Jacky Ewing
text: They are absolutely the best wrecker company I’ve ever dealt with period. The drive was friendly and very compassionate. They made a terrible night a little bit better. Thanks for the great service

name: Doris Taylor
text: Great service with a smile at 11:00 pm on Easter Sunday. We evidently drove over a nail just outside of Montgomery, AL. After a harrowing experience of husbands changing tire on side of interstate we drove on donut to Loves truck stop in Clanton, AL. Since we were in a car they would not even look at the tire. Called Mims wrecker service from Loves parking lot. Derrick came to us, tried to patch the tire with no luck, gave us directions to shop 3 miles away, AND then put a new tire on the car so we could continue our drive home. Again, great service with a smile. Thank you Derrick and Mims Wrecker Service!!!

text: Came out quick late Sunday night and towed my SUV over an hour and was very friendly. Definitely would recommend!!

text: We bought a car from Fairway Auto and left our other car in the parking lot where we was told would be ok. Well We came back to get it and it was gone. Owners lied said they didn’t have it towed. I made a police report the police contacted them they lied at first but then said yes they had it towed and told us where. I called Mims and they have my car! I asked the lady on phone could I please get my moms walker out of it and some papers from doctors office for my 10 year old daughter to go and have some very important test done!  She told me I would have to pay $100 to get the papers back! And there is stuff in there that was my dads he passed away on October 30th. I don’t have $100 right now!  Now i have to waste time in making another app to get the papers all over again!  WOW!

name: Ahmad Diab
text: I’ve looked for years to find a place in Montgomery (much less anywhere) that takes care of your vehicle and that would be willing to work on my Isuzu Truck. I live in Montgomery and it is worth it to make the drive to Automotive and Truck Doctor in Birmingham. This place solved the problem no one could, my truck was throwing some arbitrary codes. It’s been a year and no problems! These people are awesome. They were all incredibly helpful, all of them know their cars. I would highly recommend  this shop. They’re extremely honest, to the point where i trust them completely and will DEFINITELY be taking my trucks back when it needs more work done. 5 stars is too low. I just learned a ton about my truck in 10 minutes. They don't do anything unnecessary and they don't cost an arm and a leg. Thank you so much!

text:
Nov 2020/Sarge
I have been going to Truck Doctor for over 10 years and always received excellent service.  The last time I was there I had a problem with my 1972 240D Mercedes my brake light came on.  It was my brake fluid reservoir sensors that was bad. They ordered me a new one that day and told me to come back the next day and they would put it on.  I arrived that afternoon and my part was there, they took less than a hour to install it and I was on my way. I was pleased with  the time it took and the price.

text: Sent car in for electrical problem, never got an estimated time or cost  from them, until they charge me a bulk of money and I had wasted so much time (>2 months). Seldom answered the phone or returned calls. Had to visit on site to get information, and they seemed to rush me out as soon as possible. It seemed to me that the owner thought I was an idiot. Misrepresented what they could actually do for my car,  even though it was a very specific problem that can be foresee easily. It ended up as 1)three months for a small issue; 2)more expensive than what the dealer would have charged; 3)terrible service and a waste of energy.

name: DSAM
text: The worst place to go for any of your car service needs. Very rude and unprofessional employees who only want to steal your money. The owner JD is one of the worst people on this planet. He advises work that does not need to be done to your car and will sell you non-genuine replacement parts that do not work. He follows by stating that he did not tell you so and so after you have given him his money for products that multiple professionals say will not work for your car. He makes you feel like a complete idiot and always rushes you out of store and never returns calls. Your car can sit here for months and you would never know what’s wrong with it. You have to drive back to the store in order for him to be rude and disrespectful. This place needs to be closed down due to the quality of work and service.

text:
It took the tow truck over two hours to after I was told it was dispatched to make a 30 minute trip. Only after giving them ample time and allowing for traffic did I call back to be told the had taken another call, one that was made after they told me the truck was on the way. Come to find out they have a contract with the state. which I understand. But if they are going to take another call and put it before mine I would think they would have the common decency to at least give me a call and let me decide if I wanted to wait three times what I was expecting. Their price was also a good $75.00 above the going rate.
I was uneducated on towing services, but now know better. I would not recommend Hank's unless you have plenty of time and don't really care how much you spend. A disaster from start to finish. Horrible business practices to leave a customer waiting all that time without at least a courtesy call.

Your driver and his partner were professional, and went above and beyond helping me get myself and my dogs to a pet friendly hotel, getting all of my luggage and dogs in. Unfortunately I left the paperwork he gave me in  his truck but please know he is absolutely an asset to your business and I'll forever be grateful for the treatment and professional manner I was treated in that evening! Drivers like him are a rarety and kiddos to him!!

text: My late father's truck got towed after 12 midnight on a Friday my son was driving the truck and went to jail , monday I called and they said 330 to get it out remind you they only towed it 2 miles when I got over there about 1 they said 390.00 they charged another 35 dollars because I wasnt there at 12 the reason and I told them I had to go to my brothers house and get my dads death certificate to get a release on it anyway the Pell city police dept said they had  few complaints on them ,I finally talk them into 360.00 but that low down shame they would take advantage of people charging that much oh it was a 100 admission fee plus 200 just for towing it 2 miles , what is the admission fee for I dont mind paying 200 towing it 2 miles which is high but then they add 100 admission fee what the hell is that for plus 35 aday storage. it should have been 200 to tow 70 storage for 2 days not 390 they wanted. that's doing people wrong and they get by with it because if you dont pay what they want you dont get your car , they got a hell of a racket going on and I'm wfiting the chief of police so they can discuss it over the next council meeting hopefully they wont be towing for Pell city a more,  and that fat boy that was there is lucky I kept my cool because I dont play no games especially when. I'm being ripped off  it was his lucky day I gave him a pass because I dont let fat boys run there mouth at me ,he must be used to talking to others like that. just beware if you call Hanks towing be ready to empty your wallet to them and that administration fee on top of towing I dont understand that ha! ha! That's a good one ,you got me this time but never again

resp.text:
Mr. Pilgrim,
All of our pricing, No matter the jurisdiction involved, Are equal in all amounts and are within regulation(s) of the state of Alabama and all local municipalities.
The administrative or "Admin" fee that is charged reflects the costs we have to pay to search within the Alabama Department of Revenue and if applicable, any other state in which the vehicle is registered, to obtain the names of the registered owner and or lienholders (If applicable) on any vehicle pulled in, Reason being as so we don't get someone coming in with a handwritten bill of sale for example, stating that they are the owner of whatever vehicle they may see in our lot is theirs, It's a safeguard measure we take to keep any customers property secure, And to ensure only the rightful owner of the vehicle is allowed to even touch it.
Your invoice copies will reflect that our storage charges are $30 per day, Which added in to your total price accrued of $360, And paid in full.
My apologies on having to meet on social media as a platform for resolution.
Please don't hesitate to contact us for any future towing needs, We'd be glad to amicably assist you in any way we can.

name: Brian Anthony
text:
I didn't use Hank's in the conventional sense, But my insurance (progressive) sent a driver out to my home to pick up my deer damaged vehicle and take it to Birmingham for Progressive to look at.
Your driver was Joey, And I haven't had a better experience with anyone during this period than he was. The tow truck the police called out to pick my truck were nice and quick, But when they asked where I wanted them to take it to, they seemed a little bit annoyed that I wanted it to go to my home, as I wanted to talk with my insurance agent first. I suppose they prefer taking them to their place or a body shop.
When they unloaded my truck, a good bit of the plastic from the headlight and grill fell out on the tow truck, And the driver just brushed it off into my yard where my truck was sitting. I didn't think much of it, I'd just clean it up in the morning when I went out to take pictures to start working with my insurance.
I talked to my insurance, They told me because it's a newer model truck,  That they would have someone from their salvage provider come pick it up, I believe it was 3 days later when I got a call from a lady from IIA or IAA, saying that she was about to be giving a driver the information to come pickup my truck and verified my address and the damages with me.
Not too terrible long after I spoke with her and said ok to having another tow truck company come out, Joey actually called me when he was roughly 30 minutes away from my home to verify my address and that everything was ready to go. He showed up just as he said and came to the door and got me to explain why he was there, And actually gave me the rundown on the process of what would happen if progressive did or did not total my truck. I handed off my keys to him, He went and got  his truck from the street and backed it in to where he'd be able to load it up. Before he backed up into the location, he did ask me if I had septic in the area (I I didn't)  He said he always asks when he has to enter a yard,  Said he's never had a problem with accidentally finding a tank but really didn't want to have to make phone calls explaining a problem!  LOL!
He got down under my truck and did his work with some chains, Put it in neutral to wind it up his truck and chain it down. Now, this is where I became surprised,  He picked up every piece of plastic and debris that had come from my truck and put them in the bed. I never asked him to!
I asked why he did and he said he wanted it to be just as if he and my injured truck were never there. I'm still amazed that there a people that have that mindset.
We talked for a few more minutes as he finished loading and chained my truck down, I asked where they were out of and he gave me a business card with everything on it. I'm in Chilton county, So it's not feasible for me to call a company that's an hour plus away,  But he told me that you have trucks all over the place at any given time, And to call if I needed help, That you might be right down the street!
As I said early on, I never thought that my best experience in this headache would have been the guy that picked up my truck and towed from my home to Progressive's auction yard. It ended up being totaled,  But I'm loving my new blue f150!
Thank you to Joey and Hank's!

resp.text: That is so amazing to hear, Brian! Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback with our team at Hank's Towing Service. It's great to know that we continue to provide our customers with everything they need. Have a great day!

name: Eden Snyder
text: For anyone considering calling this place for a tow, save your time and money and stay FAR away!! We have had not one, but TWO horrible experiences with this tow service. The first time, they left my 70 year old Father stranded in 90° weather for hours on end, we have AAA and they assigned Hank's to the tow job. They accepted the job and didn't call/notify/cancel the job to give my Dad the opportunity to get another company assigned to the job, they just left him stranded!!! Then, my husband called them last night and they accepted his request for a tow directly,no AAA,  he called them himself since they were close. They told him they would be there in no more than 45 minutes. 1 hour later, no word. He calls them back, they say they took another job and would get him as soon as they finished. 3 HOURS LATER, my husband is still stranded and calls them for the third time. They end up telling him he may be better off calling another company. God forbid what would have happened or how long my husband would have waited if leaving it up to them to follow up on a service they accepted to begin with. Y'all are clearly in the wrong business, and people can be seriously hurt or have personal things in their life that an be SEVERELY affected by your negligence and lack of consideration. Thank God they weren't on their way to work or something pressing that required a timely arrival. Lesson learned. I will be sure to let AAA know to never assign this business to my tow jobs again, and I would recommend the same to all of you, unless you want yourself and loved one's to be stuck out in the middle of the night with no help or in the blistering Alabama heat. Spread the word, Hank's is not a reliable service and should not be in the business they are!

I’m just gonna say this, this guy was extremely nice and helped me out a lot, wasn’t expecting the price but I’m not used to using a tow truck service so it could’ve been for mileage I’m not sure. I rate them 5 stars because they really helped me and was very considerate for my two year old daughter. We sat in the air conditioning because he was more worried about her than anything else. Thank you guys so much!

text: Very good service and price. I needed a front end nose and they had it. Edward Jr. sent me some pictures of it. It looked good. Said I wanted it. They got it ready on time when I needed it. Drove up from south eastern Louisiana, the part was just as described, and in good shape. They loaded it up and we were on our way back in less than an hour. I would recommend them. Thanks Edward Jr.

text: Drove 91 miles to get a pair of doors after TWICE confirming that they were Silver and not Grey. Got there and we couldn't find the car. After walking around for an hour we found a grey car. The owner needs to fire the manager for incompetence. Very lethargic and unhelpful manager who has no idea what they have and no care to assist and Truly confirm items. Don't shop here! Go to Myers in Hiram, Ga. Very good place.

text: Called about a part and was given the information I needed, called back a few hours later to ask a few more questions and was told the part I needed was no good, the car had been underwater. When I asked why was I told earlier a price, $1100, on a part that was no good the guy got smart with me. He said he was the person I talked to. My question is why would you have parts entered in your computer system that are no good? Seems like a waste of time to me. I told him no wonder he had a bad Google rating.

name: Steve Hockie
text: These guys are a joke.  I have call several times over the past couple of years, looking for parts they listed on-line.  Before they even determine exactly which part I need, they tell me "It's broke".  Once or twice I could believe, but not every time.  Why would they inventory bad parts?  How do they even know the part is bad before I tell them the specifications of what I'm looking for?  Idiots. I believe any positive reviews are probably written by the halfwits working there.

I bought a motor for a Volvo XC90 from them. The motor ended up having a bad knock in it when we finally got around to installing it. It was way past the the 30 day warranty listed on the sales receipt. I asked them to swap this one out for another good one. They DID no bullsht no nothing just brought it out and I want to thank them.
Edward @ Vulcan Motors in Pelham Alabama

text: They towed my car when i put bad gas in it. They are very professional. The driver let me ride with him and he dropped me off at my moms. Very helpful, and great people.

name: Dan Ciesielski
text:
Totaled my car 3 hours from my home. I spoke to the owner (he was the one extricating my vehicle from the median) before being put into the ambulance.  He assured me that I could retrieve my medicine and CPAP from my car once I was discharged from the hospital. I clarified that it would be after hours, otherwise I would get my stuff at that time. Again, he assured me that it would be fine.  I might have to wait a while, but fine.
To make a VERY long and disappointing story short. He was not a man of his word even when offering him a very large cash "tip". I (the wife had to come get me 3 hours) to drive all the way back to Nashville for medicine and still no CPAP. .
Then upon my return the next day (of which I announced prior via phone call) to retrieve my personal belongings and work tools, he had a sheriff's deputy present in the parking lot, though no verbal or physical threat had been made.
This is not to slander, but to inform. I pass no judgements as it is not my place to do so,

name: Tiffany Adams
text: Had the muscle and experience to lift the overloaded reefer unit that had sank into the mud so deep it was denting tge bottom side of the fuel tank. We tried lifting with 2 forklifts with a combined load capacity of 7500 lbs and both of them  were flipping over just being used as support to keep the unit from sinking any lower. But corbin came to the rescue and got us back on solid ground... thanks a million!

resp.text: Thank You for the support Tiffany. Just give us a call anytime you needs us that is what we are here for. Have A Great Day!

name: Derek Wood
text: I wish I could leave less than zero stars. They charged 50 for cleaning up the site,which they didn't do and 150 to turn the car over, which would have been fine but it wasn't upside down,they didn't do it and wouldn't release car until it was paid. Crook,please find someone else that's honest. You've been warned

name: Lindsey Mitchell
text: There wasn't a person I dealt with that wasn't rude or short with me. Wouldn't recommend but it's not like there is much of a choice in this town with no other tow places near.

resp.text: Lindsey Mitchell I am so sorry you have had a bad experience with us. I have tried to find you in our data but I can not find you I have even went back 3 months. Please give me a call so that I can find out what happened and whom you dealt with. If it was a tow it was just dispatch but if you was in a accident that will be dispatch,drivers and office employees. It's very important to us for everyone to be treated kindly so we would like to get this fixed immediately.

name: wendy moran
text: Mr. Corbin towed my daughters car after she totaled it. He and his wife are very professional. What really stuck with me though was that both of them were generally  concerned about my daughters well being after the wreck and asked about her. Then said they would keep our family in prayer.... this is an awesome family owned and operated company and I highly recommend them for all of your needs. Mr. Corbin keeps his prices reasonable as well which is a major plus with me...

resp.text: Thank you. We appreciate the kind words. Always here if you need us.

text: Man working night shift real smart for no reason. . Just fyi it doesn't take 6 people to load a truck when 5 or the 6 are standing around looking stupid. Also you never know what people can do. I can get I could load it alot better then the guys out. .

If you could let us know what happened and when it happened we will look into it for you. We always try to treat everyone as we would want to be treated. You can email us at corbinservicesllc@gmail.com or give us a call @ 205-594-5445. Thank You for your review.

text: WARNING: When my teenage daughter and her two friends had car trouble they called AAA who sent out a truck from Till's Wrecker Service. They towed the car and drove the 3 girls to Atlanta. During the drive the tow truck operator took out his handgun, showed it to the girls and commented that he didn't want to have to use it in traffic. This has also been reported to AAA.

name: April Rowell
text: Tills Wrecker Service is one of the Best companies in Butler County there Drivers are dedicated to there Jobs there dispatchers are also dedicated Debbie and Ken Till the owners are awesome people the dispatchers Mrs Beth and Stomri will get you a Driver ASAP .... I personally know Mr Allen he has served his country and is a veteran and has drove a tow truck for over 30 years loves his job and loves to minister to his customers ❤ Brad,Cody,Chris,Mr Ken also are Drivers and they stay busy all the time they are Great people they see so much through accidents and still push through Towing isnt a Job it's a Life Thank you Guys and Ladies for all yall do yall are Great ❤

name: Christopher Powell
text: Excellent company & even better than Excellent service

name: Blake Stringer
text: These guys are great!! Friendly and prompt service, even on a weekend night!

name: Tyna Carter
text: These are the rudest people ever! My mom had an accident in Greenville on a Friday night. We told the driver to take the car to Joe Hudson and he said okay.  My mom left a few things in the car so my husband dropped by to pick them up. Ken told him she needed to sign a release.  I had never heard of a release so I called the claims department and they said they have never heard of that. I called Till's and spoke with a lady who was extremely rude. She said they were never informed on where to take the vehicle. I told her that is not correct. We gave the driver instructions.  We went back and forth for a while and she finally said they will have the car there by either the end of the day or first thing in the morning.  I told her we need it done today because that is what they said they would do. With an attitude she hung up. I called back and asked her what was her name and she asked why do I need to know that? I said because I want to talk to someone about how you just talked to me. She said with a little laughter.. I'm the manager it doesn't get any higher than me. I said there is an owner right. She said yes but he is not in and that goes through me too. I said well I will keep calling up there until I speak to him because he needs to know how you talk to customers. Shortly after Ken calls and states the same thing. They never got instructions and I told him that was not true. He said they need a release and I said ok send me the form and we will get it sent over. He said we just need her to call us and tell us where to take it. If he had said that this morning she could have called earlier.  Can you say "storage fees."  I have NEVER written a bad review on anyone because I know how people lie on reviews but I had to do one. I provide customer service every day and I don't talk to people that way even when they are upset about something.  And to be rude because you dropped the ball is unacceptable.

resp.text: I find it hilarious that you're an insurance agent and you're saying you've never heard of a release form or verbal release on accident vehicles. The confusion began with your mother in law, because she had never spoke with anyone from our office. She had only spoke with someone from Joe Hudson. However, if writing bad reviews on Google helps you sleep at night and makes you feel like you accomplished something then good for you. I guess it was okay for you to yell and talk over people when you were on the phone with the owner. Funny how people only like to tell their side of the story. Have a blessed day mam.

name: Theprissy Poshpossum
text: Debbie and Chris were great! We were helping a college student from out of retrieve her things from her car that was totaled outside of Greenville. Response was quick and professional. Chris helped us retrieve her remaining items for her so we could get her to a rental car place and on her way. Thanks again! Butch & Jennifer Sims

text: Professional, punctual, and everyone goes above and beyond to assist you! This is a small family owned business and Ken is definitely top notch!

text: My wife and I were traveling home to Birmingham, on a very hot Sunday afternoon, after a weekend in Greenville Alabama when we experienced vehicle problems on I 65. After contacting AAA, they indicated Till Wrecker Service would be at my location in 45 minutes. Till’s employee, Allen Jackson, arrived in about 30 minutes and immediately had my wife move to his air conditioned truck and loaded our vehicle on his car-hauler. Mr. Jackson proceeded to transport us over 100 miles and could not have been a finer gentleman and a credit to Till Wrecker Service.

resp.text: Glad we were able to assist during your time of need!

text: Our family is from out of state. We had car trouble and called R&R. They responded right away and even gave us the name of a guy who could fix our truck. The truck was ready the next day. They really saved us alot of time and money. Highly recommend!

name: Johndra Culp
text:
Rayson was Phenomenal!!
I was passing through Andalusia headed to Huntsville. My cars engine starting acting up quickly.  I was able to get it to Nelson’s auto shop (another fantastic  person) as it was dying.
I needed to get it towed to Hamilton Hyundai
I got it all set around 1:20 with Hyundai Roadside assistant who got it confirmed with AAA. I was told it should be 1-2 hours but most likely one. There are so many more details to this disturbing story but was finally told by a AAA supervisor that after leaving me stranded for over 5 hours that the driver could not make it. I was never called by anybody this whole time. I initiated every call and was on hold nite than i can tell you. My partner, who drove 1.5 to come get me googled tow services near us and R&R came up. She called while I was just hanging up from the useless supervisor with AAA. It was now 6:30. Rayson said he would be able to pick it up the next morning at 8:00.
After the experience I had with AAA, I was a little skeptical. He said he would call at 7:30 the next morning. So we drove back to Santa Rosa Beach. Guess what? He called at 7:27.
It’s about a 1.5 hour drive so I got there at 7:50
He got there at 7:55.
He was kind, professional, concerned, on time and VERY reasonable. He took my car 75 miles to Ft Walton and got it there safely and gave them all the necessary paperwork.
I will say he was the saving Grace of that miserable day and I can’t thank him enough!

name: Bonita Utterback
text: There absolutely the best hands down ....

name: Richard Thompson
text: They are really high. I wouldn't recommend them to anyone. They towed my Nissan Truck almost three miles and kept it two days and charged me 450 dollars to get it back. They are a bunch of crooks. STAY AWAY FROM THERE IF ANYWAY POSSIBLE !!!!!!!

resp.text: Hello Richard, I’m sorry about your bad experience with a towing company. I can promise you this was not R&R Towing & Recovery & Auto Sales in Andalusia, Alabama as we are a family owned and operated business. We have one tow truck and one tow truck driver, which is myself. I haven’t towed any Nissans or had any in my storage. Being that we are a small family owned and operated business we get most of our business by word of mouth. Being as this issue isn’t with us but another towing company can you please delete this review? Thank you

name: David Pfeilsticker
text: Rayson is the definition of amazing. He restored our faith in humanity. My wife and I were traveling from Memphis to Destin for our very first vacation when tragedy struck. My transmission went out on my truck. I called R&R and he was there within minutes. He drove us back to the shop where he was able to find me a new transmission and someone to put it in for me at an extremely reasonable cost. He also used his own personal car to drive us to our resort so we could start our vacation with minimal hiccups. Thank you so much for saving our vacation and for helping me get my truck fixed so quickly! I would recommend you to anyone that has issues in your part of woods.

text: I have been in the body shop repair business for over 30 years so I consider myself to have a better eye for quality than most people.The reason I picked this shop to do my repairs was because of Joel Allen he and did some PDR repair for me and the quality of the repair was second to none!! My review starts off with my estimate with my estimate. Gary Wrote an outstanding estimate! With Gary you not only get someone that is very knowledgeable on cars but you get someone that can actually do the repairs that he writes that is very rare! Now the Repair.They actually finish the repair sooner then they had previously estimated I was amazed most shops are always behind on their estimated time of completion. The quality of the repair was better than I expected!! they did stuff beyond what was written on the estimate and the quality was even better than I expected from Joel. Me being a painter myself I can recognize a quality paint job and I will have to say Jason put one of the best paint jobs that I have seen in the state of Alabama he is truly One of the best painters in the state!!

name: david harris
text: Great staff friendly, mechanics know there stuff

name: Njomza Hasani
text: I don't know where to begin I am  shocked and disgusted with the customer service received from this place.I have never been one to leave a bad review but if I could I would leave - star reviews.One of our trucks from the business was experiencing some issues so we brought it in for them to look at it.They told us that the fuel pump needed to be replaced and gave us a quote on it.We  decided to go with them even though it was way above what others quoted.Keep in mind they told us what they were sure was wrong with the truck.Few days later the give us a call stating that the turbo on the truck went out and said that in all it would be 15k parts and labor included, but they reassured  that after this it wouldn't have any more issues, a few days  go they work on the truck tell us to come pick it up that it was ready for us to take it back out on the road that everything was fixed and we didn't have anything to worry about.We drive pick up the truck 200miles after leaving the shop the truck goes out again.We decided to give to owner a call and told him that we just spent 15k on them preparing the issues his response was hanging up on a customer that spent that amount on fixing the issues that he reassured that the complications were fixed, with that being said I would not trust an owner of a business that takes 15k from a hard working family and hangs up when a customer calls to tell them they are having the same issues he supposedly fixed.He didn't fix the issues correctly and instead of trying to resolve the issues cuz I understand we are only human we make mistakes but the way he went about it was all wrong.You sir will be hearing from my lawyer !!

resp.text: I’m sorry for any problems we may have caused you. I understand your friend Leart Hasani ask you to post a negative review on our business because he is upset his truck is having problems. I can assure you that we are working with him to get his problem resolved. I have been in contact with him the last two days and we are trying to figure out his problem. We are not doing him wrong. Thanks and God Bless

text: This place is redicious when it comes to big trucks needing road side repairs,  the mechanic was incompetent calling his self working on the truck for 5 hours and  couldn't find the problem but want to charge darn near $800.00 for coming out, fellow truckers think twice before using this so called business for roadside emergencies::::: in response to the owner response you're either a liar or you have done someone the same cause I had my truck towed to a reputable truck repair shop

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with our service. As your bill was only $375 for 50 miles of travel and 5 hours of work then we had to wait 2 hours to get paid I don't think was a bad deal. When your truck was not running when we arrived then you drove away after repairs but then run out of fuel was out of our control. Please contact us if you would like to discuss further as we take our work very serious and aim to please everyone in the trucking industry. 256-234-3981

name: Susan
text: I thought the computer had gone out in my car. It was pulled all the way in the garage, wither no way room to get in front to open the hood. Trevor showed up from AA and was able to open the hood… but my battery was in the trunk, at which time I had discovered my trunk had been accidentally opened, leading to a dead battery!!! He jumped my battery and the sun came out in my world again!He was such a nice young man! Thank you so much!!!

resp.text: Thank you Ms Susan!  It's always a relief when the solution is a simple one, and so much better than having to buy a computer!  You're quite welcome, and we look forward to helping again should you need us!!

resp.text: Thank you Ms Cindy!  Always satisfying to hear our efforts are recognized and appreciated!  We would be glad to assist again should you need our services!

name: Gonathan Mack
text: Everyone I've met was nice and friendly... I love the fact that; I wasn't treated strange because of my race... That really meant alot to me...

resp.text:
Well, thank you for the review and kind words!
In reality, we are all the same species, just different pigmentation... and in my experience, that does not define WHO you are!
I'm glad we were able to assist, and look forward to helping you again should our services be needed!

text: They were super quick to pick up the phone. It didn't take them long at all to get too me. Super awesome people. If u ever need a tow u need to call AA wrecker. They dont play.

name: Leslie Hughes
text: I needed a tow at 5:00 one afternoon - rush hour.  Being new to town, this group was recommended to me by the Decatur Honda service folks, so I gave them a call.  Russ was awesome!  He narrowed down where I was, using my rather vague description of my location in Athens.  He dispatched someone to rescue my car off the side of the road, and he coached me through where I might leave the key and how to check my insurance card to see if the tow was covered.  When we discovered my insurance would cover the tow, he said he'd arrange to bill them directly.  From start to finish, they are SO NICE AND HELPFUL and I will definitely call them again if I ever need a wrecker.  Highly recommended!!

resp.text: It was our pleasure to assist Ms Leslie, and welcome to North Alabama!  Thank you for the kind words and recognition of our efforts.  By the way, you also demonstrated such a positive attitude during your stressful situation, which is always appreciated!

text:
Best Wrecker service east of the Mississippi!!
Honestly, they really are the best at what they do...and on top of that, they’re really good people! I was gonna scrap a vehicle out but they gave me some really good advice on an alternative I hadn’t considered. It put an extra $300 in my pocket! Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you Mr Drew!  It's always satisfying to know our efforts and knowledge are beneficial for our customers!  Going the extra mile, no pun intended, is what we always try to do, and I'm glad to hear it paid off for you!

text: Excellent service!  I am working overseas and was helping a friend who was stranded on the side of the road in the Hartselle area. I definitely recommend AA Wrecker Service to anyone in the area!

name: Holley Wingard
text: I cannot overemphasize how much I would recommend using his company to tow your car. Had such a positive interaction that it actually canceled out all the stressful, negative feelings of having a non functioning vehicle and dreading the trouble and costs involved. Russ is a very kind and competent person, extremely professional in action and appearance.  He went above and beyond to help me figure out what was wrong with my car instead of just towing me to a repair place.  He helped troubleshoot and found that my battery was weak and jump started the car to make it driveable. He told me what diagnostic tests to ask for at an auto parts store in order to determine if the battery was truly the issue and then offered to follow me to the nearest automotive parts provider. He did this and actually walked into the store with me and spoke to the gentleman behind the desk to make sure they had the battery type I might need in stock, then waited and went with the store employee and me to see how the tests came out (it was a bad battery)before he left.  He was compassionate without being condescending. A most excellent person.

resp.text: WOW...Thank you Ms Holley!  This is what we do on a daily basis, and we do strive to help when and where we can. And, it is certainly uplifting and encouraging to know that our conduct is noticed and appreciated in such a way that you would take the time out of your day to write such a positive review. By far one of my worst experiences ever!!! The staff are not helpful and they don't know what they are talking about. I could go on forever about this visit but to make it short, I was forced to cancel my home and auto insurance after being a loyal customer for 8 years. Due all to this visit

I'm still contemplating reporting them to the Better Business Bureau or the government agency that looks into insurance unfair practices. I tried filing a complaint with their company but they gave me  the run around and never contacted me back.

There is a lot more to this story and as a black woman I was downgrated into one of the hottest trends that is happening in America. I felt horrible and sad that I gave them so much of my time and money over the years. The customer service center managers were just as bad.
Oh, I forgot I would make this short. Moral of the story, Please Beware!!

name: April Renfro
text: I purchased an engine from here, was guaranteed motor was good. Paid for it over the phone and picked it up the next day. After getting the motor in it was knocking called and talked to a lady who said owner wasn’t in and he’ll give me a call back, he never called me back. I called a couple days later and he answered I let him know what was going on and he said you only have a 30 day warranty, when in fact my paperwork states I had 60. Thank god I had kept the receipt. He told me I had to fill out the warranty paperwork and present receipts. Ok no problem but on the warranty form it states that the timing belt needs to be replaced, this engine has a chain. He informed me that regardless belt or chain it’s all the same. Well I got some news from you buddy there not, a chain shouldn’t have to be serviced under normal conditions, a belt yes I agree it does. But if the motor is knocking that has nothing to do with it. This is a fair warning for anyone purchasing from here he will not refund your money and will think of any way possible not too, and he uses the square app which makes things much harder to get a refund through your credit card. But I am happy to say after over 8 months I have received my refund and hope this guy flies out of business and really feels it. I tried to do the rite thing and not go through my card company but in the end they took care of it. And I really hope this guy goes out of business.

resp.text: Hi April.  We do not have a record of you ever purchasing anything with us.  We recommend that if any item is purchased from American Salvage and is under warranty that it be brought back to our location for inspection.

name: Tiffany Busby
text: Saturday afternoon (4/3/21) I pulled in there to purchase a used tire for my Buick.  The staff was friendly enough, but the price was a little steep $51.50 but, I paid it because I was in need. Drove straight home from there. (about 3miles). Woke up Sunday morning and it was flat. Aired it up enough to get it back up there Monday morning..  When I got there and tell them the problem they took the tire off and said my valve stem was bad and charged me $20 to replace the valve stem. I thought all was good, woke up Tuesday morning it was flat again. I called & spoke to Chris who told me that it was more than likely a cracked rim and there was nothing he could do about it. Today...FRIDAY, I took off work to take my car to Fortners. They first told me that the tire was the wrong size. Then when they got it off the rim they showed me 4 plugs where the tire had been repaired 4 times, previously. For $30 I got an almost perfect Firestone tire, that was the right size with alot of tread. The actions and unprofessionalism at Chris Tires/Havana Tires was ridiculous and I intend to call the BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU.

name: Kathryn Davis
text: I had a trip to Birmingham the next day to take my daughter to her surgery follow up appointment, so I came in the night before to purchase four good used tires. There were only two employees working at the time an I guess they got overwhelmed because more people were in need of service; mind you I was the first customer an they should have been working on my car, but the guy kept stopping to help other people that had pulled up. So finally I had enough an asked the guy to please finish with my car, because I had to go rest before getting on the road (at that time I had been there close to 2 hours). So he did, an I was on my way. We made it through Montgomery without any problems, an then I was awaken by a loud noise, screeching tire sounds, and the sight of my front driver tire rolling away parallel to my truck, heading towards the grassy median. By the grace of God we were not hurt. The inside of the rim was shredded, the bolts were gone, the studs ate up. All this was caused by the a negligent employee that didn't properly tighten the bolts to secure the tire. I spoke with the owner about getting help, but none was offered, an he even tried placing the blame somewhere else. But I will never give Chris Tires anymore of my money/business nor will I recommend them to anyone. I spent over $600 to have my car fixed. I even checked the other tires an the bolts were not secure on them either. Lesson learned, u can't support everyone. I hate that I have to give them one 🌟😡 cause they don't deserve that.

name: Taneshia Pendleton
text: Very personable, knowledgeable, and real people. Scott's is pretty much like family now! For years I was a Firestone customer but after several disappointing visits we started looking for another option. I have never had a mechanic or auto shop that I felt I could truly trust. We call them for everything regarding our cars and even recommend to our friends.

name: Jenae Jeffers
text: I like to drive my cars until the wheels fall off so I need an auto repair place I can trust. I've been going to Scott for about 8 years now and have always regretted it when I went somewhere more convenient (there are several places really close to where I live). He does good work, his prices are reasonable, and he's let me supply my own parts on occasion.

name: Stephen Johnson
text: My daughter's car broke down while traveling home to NC. Scott and his crew were friendly and quick to help in the diagnosis and estimate for repairs. They even diagnosed and repaired an ongoing electrical issue after doing the AC system work. The work was completed properly, efficiently and for a fair price. I would recommend this facility for any vehicle repairs. Thanks again, guys!

name: J Olinger
text: Scott's auto was great. My truck broke down in Birmingham, and I took it to Scott's. He looked at it, called me with what he had found, and offered his solution. He was able to find a bulletin from the manufacturer that offered a suggested fix. He is knowledgeable and explained everything clearly. He was able to do a major repair quickly. If you're looking for an honest, knowledgeable mechanic, look no further.

resp.text: So glad that you are happy with your repair. Please call with any questions or concerns.

name: Beth Edwards
text: This morning my aunt and cousin brought my aunt’s car to be looked at, because we couldn’t go home to North Carolina with the car’s issues. She was so happy with their customer service and how fast they were able to get her car fixed. We were able to head home this late morning. You were the answer to prayers Colleen Pope.

resp.text:
So very glad that we were able to get you back on the road. Thank you for the review. Customer service is very important to us.
Terri Brummitt

text: Great staff. Honest, knowledgeable, dependable and friendly. Highly recommend using them for your auto needs.

name: colodude18
text: My wife and I were driving my daughter's 11-year old Dodge Neon cross-country from Denver, CO to Panama City Beach, FL, when it broke down in Alabama. It was towed to Scott's shop on Saturday and he quickly diagnosed it had a blown head gasket and broken water pump. He personally drove us to the Birmingham, AL airport to pick up a rental car so we could continue our trip to FL. He managed to get the car fixed within a week so I could pick it up the next Saturday and drive it down to FL for our daughter to use during her 3-month internship there. The repair was done right, in a very short period of time, and at a very reasonable cost. If only Scott were closer,  I would have him maintain all our cars from now on!!

name: Tanner Wallis
text: Great people. Good prices. Highly recommend

name: RyNea Soul
text:
Great experience, professional and awesome customer service. Scott and his mechanics are very knowledgeable about the services they provide and the prices are reasonable.

They appear to care about their customers. While waiting, I met ppl who only use Scott's and had been for years. I recently received a thank you card in the mail from Scott's. I will not be using any chain shops (i.e. Express Oil) again. Scott's wife manages the office and does an awesome job doing it. She has a great attitude, and provided great customer service as well. I recommend Scott's Auto Repair!

text: A repair job another shop performed recurred 14 months later, but I was told by that shop that the parts were out of warranty. I took my car to Scott's Auto Repair and I learned that the other shop cut corners on the job. Scott's fixed their blunder at a third of the cost. I highly recommend Scott's Auto Repair to anyone look for a quality repair job at a fair price -- and who doesn't want that?

text: Scott seems to know his stuff. Wish he charged me what he quoted though.

name: Taylor Ray
text: Came in to get oil leak fixed and it cost me around $800, left it when them for the day and picked it up later. When I got home the engine was violently shaking so I immediately took it back up there and they forgot to put a hose back on, I understand mistakes happen, but now the car is leaking in the same spot.

name: Rebecca Hatten
text:
Was with my friend late last week who needed her car towed.  We called her insurance and they sent out a tow truck who suggested Scott's.  We were grateful for the advice and had the car towed to that location.  2 days go by with no call from Scott's so my friend finally called for an update and learned they were already trying to replace parts on the vehicle without her permission!  Then Scott's tried to go ahead and charge her EVEN THOUGH the rep we talked to said specifically that no work would be done without them calling her first.  So then my friend has to have her car towed again from that place.
I do hope that the reviews on this place already posted are legit and that most people have had a good experience with this company.  We will, however, NEVER recommend Scott's to anyone we know because of our experience there.

name: Brenda Thornton
text: Had my car towed, service was good, but I did notice that some things in my car had been moved around. My suggestion is that YOU make sure that you remove all items from your car before having it towed. It is the drivers responsibility to make sure its done, if not you may LOSE out.....So be very mindful when using any tow service. As stated earlier, it is the drivers responsibility to make sure any items of importance be removed. So be careful and remove all items before being towed or releasing your vehicle to anyone. Thanks

resp.text: Ms. Thornton, your vehicle was in an accident causing things to be moved around during the accident and during transport.  You came to our location to remove your personal belongings and never mentioned missing any personal items.  It is our policy to only remove personal items upon request of the registered owner.  If you lost any items from your vehicle I can assure you that it did not happen while the vehicle was in our possession.

They treat each and every customer like family and always take care of business in a prompt and professional way. Always very reasonably priced. I use them personally, and recommend them to all of my customers, and they always go above and beyond. Highly recommend!

text: Considering the high-stress circumstances involved in a car crash in rush-hour traffic on a very busy and congested highway, my experience could not have been any better thanks to the patient, kind,  considerate and supremely professional treatment I received from both Mr. Tim Goodreau and his wife.  They both went out of their way to accommodate my situation, including securing my belongings and provide me with the time needed work with my insurance company in order to secure the trailer I had been towing and which was damaged in the wreck.  They do business the old fashioned way - with honor and integrity.  Without hesitation, I am proud to give Goodreau’s Towing my highest recommendation.

resp.text: We are glad that we were able to help make this difficult time a little easier for you!  Thank you for the kind review

text: Five star experience all the way around. Should be 10 stars. Truck broke down on the interstate and was able to limp it to the next exit. Called my roadside assistance company and they gave me their number for a tow. Well the issue was, I had a camper in tow. Nancy answered the phone and was immediately willing to help. They came with a tow truck for my truck and a dually for the camper. They towed my truck to their shop and my camper to the campground. Because we were traveling they moved me to the front of the line and Mike and I had spoken on the phone and thank goodness his phone diagnosis was spot on. 2–3 hours later and my truck was fixed. I had already booked the campground for the night, so we stayed. All I can say is they went out of their way to help us out and even offered to take us grocery shopping if we needed to. You just don’t get service like that everywhere and I am truly appreciative for everything they did. Even thought I don’t live in the area, I would highly recommend Mike, Nancy, and the family for great prices and service!!!!

resp.text: I apologize that you had a bad experience. I tried to check into this but I'm unable to locate what vehicle based off your name. We have regular buisness office hours to release vehicles Monday-Friday 8am-5pm. Unfortunately, we don't have someone sitting up there on weekends to release a vehicle (as well as most other towing companies). We only take cash on impounds due to being burned one too many times by other customers. We also haven't had a complaint on any damaged items inside a vehicle at our lot. We have cameras so would gladly look into this. So it seems as if you may have us confused with someone else. Please feel free to call the owner Coty @ 256-580-5096 to discuss this issue. Thanks and have a great day!

The insurance company advised us there was no rush the vehicle was at a dealship and the key was with the dealership. They did not tell us the customers was waiting with the vehicle. When we arrived on scene the police department called us onto an accident with a vehicle blocking the roadway. We have a contract with the police department and have 20 mintues to be on scene. I apologize you feel like your call wasn't a high-priority in that situation. We would have sent the next available driver as soon as possible. If you have any further concerns please feel free to contact us.

name: Michelle Kuznicki
text:
I was heading to Gulf Shores, AL from Hazel Green, AL when my 2014 Jeep took a nosedive in Prattville, AL. After taking it to a Jeep dealership up there, and getting the call that nothing was wrong diagnostically and to come get my vehicle, I started my journey to Gulf Shores once again the next day.

However, about an hour into my drive my Jeep failed again. I chose D and D Automotive at random because I was in the middle of nowhere and had zero clue about my surroundings. I am so glad I did.

After my insurance company got me safely to their shop via tow truck, both Mr. Gary and Joe helped diagnose the issue (it was in fact the alternator), explained the repair to me, checked on me several times (mind you, I was in their shop for close to 6 hours with no where to go), and were incredibly knowledgeable about their trade.

I grew up around cars and can tell pretty quickly when people are in this business to rip off those in need and I can say, without-a-doubt, this shop genuinely cares about their patrons and those they serve. They could have *easily* waited to work on my car the next day but they were immediate in their desire to help and get me back on the road.

I could not be more thankful for their help and cannot recommend them enough. Hearts of gold and quality work, D and D Automotive is the place to go.

resp.text: Michelle, thank you so much for the positive feedback. We appreciate the 5 STARS!  We are so glad we would get you back on the road.   We appreciate your business and let us know if we can ever assist you again. Safe travels!

name: Ira Gordon
text:
After receiving a very steep quote from a competitive towing company, I called Tony's Towing Inc. and spoke to a woman. She said that both of the tow drivers were busy at the moment, but that she'd call to let me know when one was on the way.

A short time later (about 10 minutes or so), one of said drivers called me directly and let me know that he was about 15 minutes away, but that he was on the way. He arrived just as he said he would and got me loaded. While driving to my destination, he gave me an estimate that was surprisingly lower than the first company. He and I talked the entire way. When we reached my destination, he did some calculating and his original estimate was spot on. After lowering the car onto the driveway, he even helped me back the car into the carport. I wasn't able to compensate him for going above and beyond, but the least I could do is keep my word and write a review.

From start to finish, my experience with Tony's Towing Inc was great.

Ellis, if you're reading this, I enjoyed our conversation as well and appreciated the advice. Thank you for your service in your former fields. Stay safe out there, man.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review!!

name: Eli Gelsinger
text: Absolutely awful experience here. The service representative gave me an extremely difficult time trying to get my car out of repo. My car was clearly listed to have two buyers (me being the co-buyer). As I'm showing him my ID to show that I have the authority to withdraw my vehicle he has the nerve to lie and say that I'm not listed as a buyer. I told him countless times that there is paperwork in my car that can proove otherwise. He lied and said the paperwork wasn't in my car. After jumping through a goosehunt of obstacles. I finally get my car back and sure enough, the paperwork is in my car that shows i am the co-buyer. It's almost like these people get a thrill out of giving you a hard time.

resp.text: First, we don't repo.  Secondly, we must follow all strict guidelines as the laws requires (police give us the information).  It is no different than dealing with the courthouse or the license office, all paperwork must be correct and exact.   If we released vehicles to everyone that says "I am the owner", etc. we would have even more complaints.

text: Great service. Sonny was my towing operator, knew exactly where my car was, even though i was in apartment complex in Gulf Shores. Made sure my car and keys were taken to the right person at Honda.

name: J Laine Lucas
text: I worked all day on the day of the Christmas Day parade which starts at 7pm. There were no signs when I parked my car and where I parked that morning. I never left the office until I got off at 5:30 my car was towed. I walked to the tow lot which was in some backyard of a home and had to pay $125 for them to move my car a block (from the corner of the art center to behind soul bowls). I explained my situation and it landed on deaf ears. I work just like they do. To make a living for the holidays to provide for my loved ones, just like they do. But they exploit a contract with the city and told me that either the city would have to pay for it or I would. They in no way care who you are what your situation is or have any epthany. I reluctantly paid but will be taking my case to the City of Fairhope. Regardless I will have a better chance with the city than I will at Tony’s Towing. They do not care about you. I’ve had another experiece with them after I totaled my truck and while I was shaken up the police office on the scene called to have it towed for me. Tony’s showed up loaded up my truck and I asked how much it would be he said insurance has it covered. My insurance is liability only and did not cover the towing as he assumed. For them to tow the truck 1.6 miles it cost me $200. I had other options but when I explained this to them again they don’t care. If it’s ever a choice do not use them.  It’s December, it’s the holidays. Have some empathy for people. Stop Treating people like garbage.

resp.text:
First and foremost, I apologize for the super late reply.  I have just gotten the Google account working again.
Parade towing is something Tony’s Towing, Inc. has no control over.  The city makes all signage, they tell us which vehicles to tow individually, and through the city ordinance, they even tell us how much we can charge (which is actually less than it would be for a private property tow).  I understand your frustration, but the police had your vehicle towed, not us.  We are simply a tool exercised by the city.  The reason for the holding yard “in some backyard” is to provide a convenient place for you to pick up your vehicle.  Our main towing yard in across town, which would have cost you a taxi ride and made the experience even less desirable.
We are a very empathetic business and have been for nearly 30 years, but unfortunately if we did not charge every person that illegally parked because they have an excuse, we would be working for free.
Once again, I’m sorry for the predicament you were placed in, but Tony’s Towing, Inc. did not create, nor exploit your situation in anyway.  We simply did our job.

text: I wish I could give this place ZERO stars!!!! I am 7 months pregnant and have been sitting on the side of the road for 2 hours for a flat tire! I called for road side assistance on my Honda and they contacted this provider. 15 mins later the provider contacted me saying he would be an hour, I had no other choice but to wait for help because I couldn’t change it myself. Another hour and a half goes by and I attempt to contact him but no answer. I call Honda and they call him and he LIES and says I cancelled the service but he failed to updated them. I am sooooo hurt. The least he could’ve done was inform them that he couldn’t take the service on. This is an awful experience, I never leave reviews for anything but this has me in tears! I am infuriated! Don’t use this company EVER!

name: Chasity Ross
text: Oh wow! - what a great experience. Clay was extremely professional and arrived much sooner than expected. He alleviated the stress we initially thought we'd encounter with having an inoperable vehicle towed. The process ran much smoother and efficiently than expected. Clay also proved himself to be an expert in respect to vehicles as well. He offered some unexpected, but great advice for the repairs required for our vehicle (It's like we got a 2 for 1 deal). In addition to being professional and having the expert edge, Clay was also very kind and didn't make us feel as though we were a burden. He was very much present and listened. Best towing experience ever! You can not go wrong with these guys. Wish I could give 10 stars! :)

name: Chris clardy
text: Champions is the best! I have used them for several towing situations and also had work done on my wife’s vehicle at their shop! No Complaints!!! But today they really came through for me big time! I locked my keys in my car on lunch break! I didn’t know it until we had already ate and was leaving to go back to the job! I called Champions and they showed right up and Clay had my vehicle unlocked within 30 seconds of showing up! Super fast! Super professional! Super affordable!!! These days!! What else could you ask for??

name: Jeff Andrews
text: Service was great, price was great! Remember when setting up appointments times may be variable... My pickup planned two days in advance was a little over an hour late. Which is fine just wish they would have called me to let me know. I called them they informed me the driver was in another county but headed my way next. Everything worked out and like I said the service was great.

text: Very courtesy & professional service. They were able to unlock my vehicle in just a few minutes. They are a family owned business and the passion shows. From towing my SUV after I had a wreck to simple road side assistance. I trust champion towing with all my vehicle  and towing needs.

name: Kyle Johnson
text: As a fellow tow company owner, I know there are a lot of good people in this industry, and I can proudly say Champions is full of those good people! I broke down 800 miles from home, and they were very friendly and understanding on the phone and very fair priced. I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

name: Krista Marie
text: Great reliable service. It was like they were there as soon as I called! Thanks Champions for taking care of my car and me!

name: Alexander Collier
text: My car was released from the tow truck without the parking brake being engaged. Nearly 2,000 dollars of damage was cause to my vehicle. I made the mistake of trusting that AAA would help take care of it. Getting in touch with Champion’s owner is a total joke. After months of negotiating an agreement was made to split the repairs for the front bumper alone (about 850 of the 2,000). Now that the bumper is fixed, I’m told that there will not be any payment from Champions. Imagine owning a tow company, dropping someone’s car off, the car rolling down a hill causing thousands in damage, and not paying a dime for it. Stand up company.

name: Arkansas Smith
text: Locked a key in a car. $65 isn't bad for being out in the county. Lady who answered the phone was polite and helpful. Service Man was out promptly. Would use again.

name: Chad Smith
text: I called because our travel trailer had a broken axle.  What a responsive group of people and so very kind.  We are still waiting on some parts to come in from Dexter, but they have been nothing but wonderful so far.  Great there are such good people still on this earth.

name: Larry White
text: Came out in a timely manner, saved me from having to get a tow truck when they have tow trucks. Didn’t just fix the problem, but also adjusted my trailer brakes bcuz he saw an axle sticking with no charge. Looked over my truck and found other problems as well. Worked all day until 4 am trying to fix my truck bcuz my driver was under a load. Checked my boxes and saw they both was low in gear oil. Topped them off and told me I had a yoke seal leak and a drive axle leak. Didn’t charge me for the oil he put in my truck. Cut down the price so I could get everything fixed bcuz he didn’t want me having problems down on the road. Sent pictures of all the malfunctioning parts and sent pictures of the new parts once installed. Called and texted the next day to make sure everything was going fine. Charged me less than what I would’ve got charged anywhere else knowingly bcuz my money was funny due to me just paying  to get my motor rebuilt by another mechanic. Told me the other problems I needed to get done in the future. I know honest mechanics are hard to come by but I have been blessed to find one and will continue doing business with this knowledgeable and honest family owned mechanic shop.  Thanks Adam!

text:
