text: These guys are awesome! Had a catastrophic wheel failure while towing a trailer at about 11 PM in the rain. These guys came and towed both my truck and trailer to their shop quickly and professionally. They were going to take me to a hotel for the night but when they asked where I was headed and found out I had a plane to catch the next day to see family they immediately got work on my vehicle (it was almost midnight at this point). They found enough lug nuts to fit my oversized Land Rover wheels and got me back on the road that night! Top notch service and some genuinely good people. Recommend highly!

After being left broke down on the shoulder of the road by another repair company.  Adam,  William and Holly went the extra mile to get my truck and trailer towed to their location and helped me secure a motel for the night.  The next morning they picked me up and to the shop so  another driver could continue with the load. (This was a Sunday morning). Adam did a check of the truck and found it was a transmission failure . They made sure that I had a room for Sunday .
On Monday they went over 100 miles each way to get a transmission and other parts and had me back on the road at a very reasonable price on Tuesday.
This is a family owned company and very professional and I would highly recommend them.  If you need anything stop by and Jo ,Holly, Adam and William and have a cup of coffee.

name: Andrew Boothe
text: I didn't use this service. I called around to get pricing for towing my car a half mile to my home, and this place along with one other quoted me a $75 charge. I told them, "No thanks," and hung up the phone. Maybe it's just standard pricing, but $75 to move a car a few blocks down the road seems absurd to me, especially since I managed to get it home for free by jumping it off using booster cables (the alternator had gone out, and the car stalled when the battery died, so all it needed was enough juice to get home). I was expecting $35-$40, but $75...? Really?

resp.text: Our drivers are certified, and we provide professional  top notch service. There are many details that go into consideration when pricing jobs. Distance your vehicle is away from our shop, and the distance it's being towed. During business hours or after hours. Type of vehicle. A rollback cost $100,000 =/-. Insurance for that truck $10,000, Just a few of the many expensive factors to consider. $75 sounds like a good deal to me.

text: These guys are awesome. 5 star service. I was moving my truck with a trailer with my whole life in it as I moved from Pensacola fl to Columbia sc. then all of a sudden my oil drain plug came undone inbetween auburn and Atlanta. Oil and smoke everywhere! I called in and they arrived within 30mins as they were located a little away. I dealt with Ben specifically and he was genuine, easy to talk with and very intelligent. He knew exactly where to go to get me a new drain plug. Not only that but he didn't leave until he actually crawled up underneath my truck to correctly install the drain plug and ensured I was good to go as I didn't have a jack to place my heavy trailer back on my truck. I definitely recommend these folks. Good people great service.

This company has been around for awhile and continue to hire new people. I never understood why they had such a high turn out until this year. The manager/owner has an absolutely terrible attitude with his staff. I don't care how cheap a business is if they treat the employees like this I will do my best to avoid them. I've personally witnessed his angry attitude while waiting to pick up my truck from a wreck. When you run a business your employees make it efficient. Without good employees you can't have a great business.

I wrote this for my grandpa, he is over 80 and asked me to help him.

resp.text: I hate you feel this way but 99% of the time when we hire new people Is because we are growing and buying more trucks so yes there is a lot of new people   And I like to hear more about this wreck your talking about call us so we can understand more what you are even talking about 256 571 7397

text: Jerry was a great service provider helped me get where I needed to go and was very friendly

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Blake. Call us if you need towing or roadside assistance in the future!

name: Shirlee Bailey
text:
This company was used by my insurance roadside assistants. They said that because I had All-State insurance they were not putting me first because All-State doesn't pay well. That tells me that it's not about who is in need of help, but how our insurance pays them. I sat on the road for almost 6 hours with 3 kids.
When I called the place in which my car was to be towed, they said it was never delivered.
My vehicle was still sitting on the road even after I was sent a text saying it would be picked up at 4:37-4:52, only it was moved about 600 feet to where we initially stopped. The kids built a pyramid of rocks while playing in the ditch, which was approximately 600 feet to where the car was. Which tells me they loaded it then put it back down. WHY IN THE WORLD WOULD YOU DO THAT? Never again.

resp.text: This was on a very busy day, we told this potential client that we would get to her once we were finished with the calls that had come in earlier. She demanded that we get to her first and after some very uncomfortable phone calls we decided that we did not want to do business with said potential client. We informed the roadside insurance of this decision.

name: Michelle Smith
text: If you want to be talked over when trying to speak or talked rude to this is the company to use. I called them to explain something just like my insurance company asked me to do. Jason was very rude telling me I shouldn’t even be dealing with him only my insurance company should call him. First off its our vehicle and I’ll call all I need to about it especially when instructed to do so by my insurance company. I was belittled and talked to rudely. Our company will not use them again. We also requested our truck be dropped off at home 3 miles from the accident. He said oh no let me take it to my lot so the insurance company will come out faster. Which we let him do and it cost us $2800.00 because they didn’t come out faster and it sat there from 6/26-8/21. I’ll say the lady in the office was always nice when I spoke with her but Jason who I believe is the owner has no customer service skills. When someone calls to ask about their vehicle you should be willing to answer any questions they have and be nice about it regardless if they have their insurance company involved or not. Especially when you’re telling me a different story then my insurance adjuster told me minutes before I called you.

resp.text: This was not a issue on Ace Towing this was matter of insurance wasn’t notified properly, and when they did come we had to do what they told us to do, we strive daily to help and be reliable to ALL our customers. Thanks

name: austin croslyn
text: If you need service and are seeking the best and most knowledgeable around, ask for Brandon Bartlett by name. Unprecedented knowledge and respect. 5/5 stars!

text: It was a Sunday morning and we broke down on interstate 65 just outside of Birmingham Alabama on our way back to central Illinois from our Florida family vacation. It  was major engine failure. They welcomed us into there air conditioned office, offered water and soda to everyone. The office help even spent a couple of hours on the phone trying to find a car rental, a uhaul, anything that could be found open early on a Sunday morning. When that came up empty they gave us a ride to the hotel that we had to book.Thank you so much for your help in our time of need. Our entire family thanks you.

I will continue to tell the story about how we found such amazing people in Evergreen, Alabama. That city is so very lucky to have this amazing auto repair shop. You guys are professional and beyond friendly and this combination makes for a very successful business. God bless.

name: Jaanki Bhakta
text: I was traveling through Alabama on I-65 N in 93 degree weather and my car’s AC decided to stop working. I googled places off the highway that I could stop to get my car fixed (I was crunched for time) and this shop showed up. I called to see if my problem was something they could take a look at and fix and they were really professional and sweet on the phone. They agreed to take me in as soon as I drove into town, and they did exactly that when I got there. They had my car diagnosed and fixed within 45 minutes (I was expecting to be there for over an hour). They were very honest and professional, and not to mention their prices were very reasonable. If I lived in/near this area, I would definitely be a regular customer! I was very impressed by their service, professionalism, and willingness to help. I wish I could give more than 5 stars!!

resp.text: Thank you for the review.   So glad we could help.

text: This shop is awesome!! My car broke down in the middle of the night when I was traveling cross country for work. I was in a situation where they could have taken advantage of me and overcharged to make some extra cash, but they didn’t. I have never been better taken care of in my life. Kay was one of the most genuine and friendly people I’ve come across. They even offered to buy me breakfast. This is a shop that is honest, professional, and pleasant to work with. I’ll never forget them helping me the way they did when they didn’t have to. My only problem is that I can’t give more than 5 stars in this review. name: Dan H
text:
I waited 6 hours for this irresponsible and non-concerned heartless individual to respond to us for a requested tow placed to them directly and through AAA.  They made every excuse in the book for refusing service to us for our SMALL travel trailer.  We would have paid up to $500 to get us some place safe but this unprofessional company left two disabled senior citizens on the side of the road well over seven hours long on a cold night and even when called after midnight would not commit to providing us service the following day and only commented “I don’t know what to tell you.”

We had to get help from my son in Raeford, NC, over 500 miles away, rather than rely on this local business.

This is a despicable human being with an I don’t care attitude.  I know karma will find this heartless S.O.B. the reward be so justly deserves.

resp.text: His small camper he keeps referring to is 23 ft long, 12 ft tall, and 8.5 ft  wide weighing in at 11,500lbs. AAA called us and we told them we didn't have the equipment to haul his camper with it having a wheel bearing out. Someone had called an hour after AAA did wanting to know when we were coming to tow their camper. Went through the spiel with them that I didn't have the equipment to haul their camper. I told them a name and phone number of a towing company in town that have a landoll trailer that should have been able to help them. Then another male called me at 1am (i am guessing the one who left the review) asking when we were going to be able to come out during the day to help him with his camper. I went through the spiel again. He kept pressuring me to send him out a truck first thing in the morning to tow his camper. In the end I told him I do not have the equipment to help you and that I was sorry. His reply was I guess you got 8 or 10 calls lined up for all your trucks tomorrow. I said no, I do not have the equipment to haul a camper that size. I don't know what else to tell you. This cold night he speaks of was 65 degrees in a closed down resututant parking lot. And I am not sure what help his son gave him because AAA called back the next day to get it towed. I still didn't have the equipment needed so I guess they got him some other provider to help. I really hate this gentleman is upset but AAA should have found him somebody else to tow it or they should have called somebody with the equipment. I am not sure why he was dead set on we had to tow it. We strive to provide the best experience for all of our customers but unfortunately we were unable to help and made that very clear as soon as we were contacted.

name: Shulls in Utah
text: We were coming through Alabama from Utah on a cross country trip and lost the rear wheel off our 25 FB Airstream Travel Trailer after pulling off the highway to get gas.  Precision Towing was so helpful to us. They came to our location, assessed the situation, devised a game plan and began work on not only towing our AS but also fixing our wheel bearing.  We feel so fortunate to have found them and highly recommend their professional and efficient staff. They represent the very best in their industry.  Everyone was so kind to our little family, we cannot thank you enough for all you did for us.

name: Karen Kelley
text: I recently got stranded in the middle of a 3-hour drive - in Scottsboro, on a Sunday afternoon when everything is closed! After unsuccessful attempts with a total of 3 strangers to stop the crazy loud car alarm & get the car to start again, I finally called AAA- wish I’d done that sooner! They promised that a tow truck & driver would arrive in about an hour, & he did- but he contacted me as well. Upon his arrival, I still had no idea where to tell him to tow me to! Fortunately he knew what I (in my stressed state) had forgotten: I have AAA Plus- entitling me to a free 100-mile tow!! He hooked me up & drove me an hour back to my dad’s in Madison, & even backed the car into his garage!!! He was professional & courteous, and when I apologized for messing up his Sunday afternoon, he was very gracious. I was able to use another car & make my trip - late but safe. Thank you- Complete Towing & AAA!!

resp.text: Hey there, thanks for the kind words! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you again at Complete Towing & Recovery.

So 30 minutes wasted on getting our key. Then we had to drive over there, another 30 to 40 minutes gone. Then we had to go to Opelika for better paperwork and back. Next thing we knew, they were closed and we had to wait another day to pick up the car.

We tried to explain that our grandmother was very sick and couldn't leave her home, and what the tow truck guy had said and she just kept getting more ruse saying that she didn't care and that it was too bad and not her problem. Will never use this place again, it was awful. If I could give negative stars I would.

He said it wouldn't be a charge,  but luckily I had a little cash on me since it was just after Christmas and my birthday so I could give him a little to cover the cost and pay him for his time and good deed. Thank you!

text: Jacob was very helpful and unlocked my car in what seemed like less than 30 seconds and in total was here less than 5 very quick and was able to get me inside my precious truck😂

text: He was about to get to me and get my car open in less than 30 mins.  He was super nice and even called a few times to update me on where he was in getting to my truck.

text: Jacob was awesome! He got here in 10 mins of me making my call. I was back on the road in no time! Thank you Jacob!!

name: Chelcie Kious
text: Jacob got my car running within seconds. I expected it to take longer. He's passionate about his job and doesn't mind waking up at 7 in the morning to make a long drive to Valley, AL.

name: Karl Sprayberry
text: When my tire blew out on the highway, State Farm called Jumpstart to help. Jacob contacted me and came to help out ASAP. He informed me when he would arrive and told me of any delays as soon as they occurred. He was very personable and even followed me to the nearest gas station to ensure I was safe. If I am stranded again, I would be happy to call Jacob and Jumpstart again.

name: Danielle Peppers
text:
Jonathan was very helpful in assisting me!
He came out to help me jump start my car.  Though he was unsuccessful because it was my  alternator, he let me sit in his car with the heat until a tow truck could come get me. He also gave me tips about my car which were very helpful. Definitely would refer this company to anyone. I only had to wait 30 minutes for service and the service was excellent !
Keep up the good work guys !

name: Chad CC
text: Within 10 mins Jacob was there to unlock my car! Very helpful, courteous, and polite. Highly recommend Jumpstart services to anyone in need of help. Thanks again Jacob!

name: Buddy Brannon
text:

Insurance said it could take 1 hour for tow truck to arrive.
They were there in 30 minutes.
Thanks...

name: Barbara Watkins
text: Had a really bad day ... had to call AAA and they dispatched Jump start towing . Driver Raymond was very professional and nice! Even gave his input to what the problem was when I described what happened. He was exactly right! So nice to have someone so polite and professional to talk to when you feel like you hit rock bottom. Thank you again Raymond!!!

name: Chris Henry
text: Jacob you did an awesome job! Fast and polite service!

name: Lakeitha Word
text: On yesterday my insurance company had this company come out and pick up my car from my home. The car was supposed to deliver my car to a home with a shop in the back of it, however the driver delivered my car to a home  that was not the address. The car was down the road from the address at someone else's home with my keys in it. After calling the company and speaking with Justin that was very rude to me stating that he did not pick my car up last night. I asked Justin to ask the owner to give me a call, and a lady called me stating that she was the owner (However she was not) she called me and was very RUDE. She was cursing at me and was very unprofessional. After telling her I was going to contact my insurance company and let them know how she had spoken to me. She stated that she did not care and that I could not threaten her by calling my insurance company. After hanging up the phone she called my phone back several of times to continue to curse me. After that her husband (the owner) called me back and he did apologize to me and was very nice to me. However, the damage was done with his wife and his employee. I have had other experiences with this company and I must say this was the first time that I have had an issue with them, but it was awful thanks to his wife.

text:
Lost key in Blakey GA about 430pm  called jump start towing Dillion called back immediately and said he would be here  40 mins to get me to the hunydai dealer by 6pm to buy a new key. He was ontime

text: Jacob was very nice and professional. I made a mistake with the timing of when he was supposed to come help fix my flat tire. He waited 45 minutes outside on me and I didn’t even know. Later, I got a call and Jacob was willing to go out of his way to come back and help me. I expected him to be very frustrated with me because I had him waiting outside for so long, but he carried himself very maturely when he arrived and was extremely understanding. He was very generous and kind to come back out and help me. He impressed me so much that I decided to write this review, and I never write reviews.

Miss Jessica S I do do apologise for your inconvenience I am sincerely sorry for the misunderstanding if there is anything I may do to make it up to you  please feel free to contact me and let me know what I can do to change your opinion once again I'm sorry for this had to be misunderstanding I would not be rude I use the line they don't pay me enough to check I d's to bring a smile upon my customers face due to enlighten their situation never in my life would I purposely be rude sorry I was just trying to help

text:
On Friday, May 28,2021 at 7am, I noticed that my husband car was gone from in front of our apartment complex. He tracked his car to a location called Rapid Towing, in Irvington,Alabama. He started calling at 7 am and no one picked up the phone until 3:41pm. We pulled up outside of the property Rapid Towing at 9:00am and had been sitting out there for 5 hours where no one came to the gate or even answered the phone.  We left at 1:00pm and still no answer. This is beyond unprofessional!!
My apartment complex need to enforce in label the fire lanes as well as place signs in front  of ALL handicap parking. My husband’s car was wrongfully towed and after sitting outside for 5 hours, they did not relinquish his car until we payed a $250.00 tow fee.

text: This wonderful towing company decided it would be a great idea to tow my vehicle on my move in day, with all of my belongings still inside the vehicle, while I was in the process of unloading my belongings into my apartment. 10 minutes later, I come outside, and mysteriously enough, my vehicle is no where to be seen. This towing company is notoriously known for predatory towing and this is the only way they can keep their business running, sadly. Not to mention, the owners are extremely disrespectful and unprofessional so do not expect to reason with them as they could care less about your situation or that the fact they tow illegally. After realizing my vehicle was towed, they did not answer their phone for over an hour until finally they answered the phone at 11:30pm and I was very surprised at how unprofessional and rude the owner was towards me. Safe to say, stay far away from this company and don’t give them a call for any of your towing needs.

resp.text: Dana Hand... I believe you're talking about the Uhaul rental that you rented thru Uhaul . We do not have anything to do with charges on your card. When your husband called and asked about the charges, he was explained we have no access to your card and to call Uhaul. Our reviews here are for Matthews Towing and Body Shop, this should not have anything to do with a Uhaul that was dropped at our shop. We just let them park the trucks at our location temporary we do not make any money off uhaul. Please contact Uhaul for them to explain charges to you, it is out of our hands.

text:
Nice enough, but not a great paint guy.
Orange peel, poor masking job, overspray, buffing compound in all door jambs and around hoods, chipped and cracked interior parts. Typical body shop bs! I expected more from this outfit. If you let it leave your shop looking that way, and if you didn’t inspect it personally, then why would you fix it right the second time I bring it back???? Disappointed

resp.text: I do apologize to Mr. OHern. If we missed something during the repair, when the vehicle was dropped off with us for the repair. Mr OHern's Lexus had front end damage. He asked us to buff some scratches on the rear of the car while in for repairs. Vehicle was completed and ready on the date promised. When Mr. and Mrs. OHern picked their Lexus up, they seemed very pleased with the repairs and bragged about the color match of the Lexus. And 3 weeks later,  Mr. OHearn called and said there was buffing compound in the door openings, I asked him if he could bring it back and we would take care of it. Several months went by, never heard from him anymore until I seen the review that was posted several months after we had spoke. I have tried to call several times and left messages for him to call me back, but no response. As far as the chipped and cracked interior parts, I have no explanation for them as we did not do any work to the inside of the vehicle. I am not trying to make excuses for us as we all do make mistakes.  I take pride in my business and customers and hate Mr. OHern feels disappointed.

text:
Signs says they open at 8am. I arrive at 7:50am. No one came at 8am. I waited till 8:30am and called the number. Some rude operator said “your suppose to call ahead of time”! I was not told this when they towed my vehicle from the wreck scene. Finally around 9am someone shows up. If your not going to be at your office don’t post business hours. Put on your business cards to call in advance!

If you don’t want wait on them to show up late and talk down to you then call someone’s else!

name: Kathy Sugg
text: Gravel came off of one of these tow trucks hauling heavy equipment while merging onto I-65 on April 27, 2021. I was traveling from TN to FL for vacation with my grandchildren.  The company refuses to pay for my cracked windshield caused by the gravel that came off of their tow truck.  I am having to file my insurance and pay a $100 deductible for damages that was not my fault.  They claiim it was road debris, however it came straight off the back of their truck.  They would be responsible had if I had a  video of the incicent.  That is not the right thing to do in my eyes.

name: Lizzie Roe
text: Very rude and TERRIBLE customer service. Car was stolen and cops called this company because they were on rotation. They said that would be easier than calling AAA. My cars battery was stolen and so they said they would take my car to their lot until we could get my insurance to look at it. But they did not mention ANYTHING about having to pay storage fees. So not only do I have to pay for the tow because they are not a company that AAA  doesn’t cover but storage as well. They then told us they would not tow my car somewhere to get fixed until we drive to hartselle (30 minutes from where I live) and pay them CASH for the tow and the storage. They told us this when we said we wanted it towed today so we won’t have to pay more storage fees and they close in  30 minutes. The driver was very rough with my car when putting it in the truck as well. I agree with all the other reviews saying this place is awful.

text: Good people. Up front and honest.

name: brittany noel
text: They are awesome people they went above and beyond for us. We had a accident in a semi, the state police did call them out but they pulled us out of the median and took us somewhere safe for the night, offered to take us to a hotel.(it was like 2 in the morning so we decided to stay in the truck.) The next morning they were there bright and early, took the trailer off delivered the load back to the plant and got our truck running. Made sure we were warm while towing us out. Hopefully we don't have issues there again but if we do we will be calling them. If y'all are reading this thank y'all very much!

text: Well I got stuck in the mud left my van on the side of the rd. Was rescued around 1030 after my dog and I was stranded with no phone for 9 1/2 hours. We had 4 cookies in the van is all we had. Water was coming in the passenger side. So we came back to get it the next day wityachain and my vehicle was gone. Now its over 500$to get and I can't afford it. My dog is grumpy around  people so he stays in my van when we go somewhere.  I couldn't take him with me anywhere. So I had to tie him up to a porch. Rain came he snapped his leash and  was gone. He now is at the pound!! Pray I get my baby back tomorrow  and can get my van back! Does anyone know if it was legal to do a tow that quick on an abandoned cqr?

You do not always know a persons situation regardless of the job you must do such as obtaining a persons vehicle it should not be displayed in such a negative unprofessional way because that person very well could be struggling to put food on the table so to make it joke that someone lost their vehicle is very unfortunate.

Big John was very courteous and professional.Got me and my vehicle home,glad I called Superior towing.

name: Billy Shirah
text: My lower ball joint went out on my truck which left me stranded on the side of the road. I called and they gave me a round about time the driver would be there. The driver called and let me know when he was on his way and when he should arrive. The driver Cody got there and was super professional. He made sure not to damage the truck any more than it already was while pulling it on the truck. Last time I had my truck towed the driver messed the truck up even more than it was so this was a big plus in my eyes. He asked me where i wanted the truck at and put it exactly where i needed it. I highly recommend them. I didnt really compare prices so I dont know how much cheaper they are compared to others but I dont mind paying more for a good experience and have someone who keeps me updated on their location and actually knows what they are doing. Cody was a huge help and very knowledgeable.

text: Uses my company's name to solicit his business! Unfortunately legal, but just plain wrong. This has caused much confusion over the past couple years to our customers, law enforcement and insurance companies. He advertises call Earl "Britton" for all your towing needs. Hazel Green Towing. Very clever but very dishonest business and definitely not a man of his word. name: christopher lively
text: Coming home from Christmas vacation our truck caught fire while pulling our camper. It was really devastating but we were lucky to save the camper. These guys where extremely helpful. They arrived shortly after the state trooper dispatched them with 2 rollbacks. They loaded my burnt up truck and towed the camper with the other truck to the there storage lots. They made sure we had gas for the generator and anything else we would need for the camper and they helped me set the camper up in the lot with all the 18-wheeler trailers in it. They let us stay the night in our camper at there lot so we wouldn’t have to get a campground until I could get the camper towed home. We left the next day but they went completely out of their way several times to help us and show that they care. It is a family business from what I can tell and they treat you like part of the family. Great service. Thank you.

name: Freida Clark DeGrado
text: On Dec 13 2018 at 12:40pm I placed a called to Owens towing we needed assistance with a fifth wheel wheel and F350 stuck in wet soil and blocking a road. The gentleman assured me he would get someone dispatched, he was finishing up on another job but would be on the way in about an hour. Meanwhile the SO came to handle traffic. We assured them the wrecker was coming asap. At 1:20 pm a text from Owens "My  guy is on the way".  2:25 p.m still no wrecker.  Directions were 431N past J & M Midway first left can't miss us because you can't pass us. 2:32 pm I call he then informs me his driver is lost.  My question how does a wrecker driver get lost?  It's 2018, we have a uniquely high tech modern invention that you would think a wrecker service would utilize, and readily available on most phones....GPS.  And why wouldn't you call and say hey my guy is lost and can't find you call someone else.  The kind gentleman from the sheriff's department got Matthews dispatched they were there in 5 minutes, 5 minutes later we were out and on the road again.  Sorry but I would have to give Owens Zero stars if I could, really bad experience.

name: Nathina Greco
text: I see all the reviews are over 2 years ago, please allow me to update you with a current review. I WILL SUPPLY PHOTOS AND AUDIO OF OUR CONVERSATIONS( from when I picked it up) TO PROVE EVERYTHING STATED HERE IS TRUE! I found Trey(the owner) via Facebook, I always do my research. I saw these reviews, and decided to give him a call, it was a week before memorial day weekend. I can provide all call logs, I told him I have an RV that has a lighting issue that I need checked. Considering I am a first time owner he said it may be a simple fix. I said great when may I drop it by? He said he is backed up and it would really help him out a lot if I could bring it by that Tuesday, I told him that sounds great. He asked that I send him my address and the issues via text before hand. I did. I had to work late and had my cousin drop it off. Please see the photos of our texts. I told him a million times DO NOT BUY ANYTHING for the RV I ONLY want a diagnosis. He took a week, and ended up purchasing: -LP for the RV, Checking the outside, HE BROKE the generator and told me that it stopped working. He even said on audio, it was working when you dropped it off. HE broke the battery disconnect again which was working when I dropped it off. When I went to pick it up he kept repeating how he put me in front of other projects and he needs more time. I explained how he told  me to bring it in on that day because he was behind the previous week. He said well ,.... this that...ect Please see the itemized bill of the charges and work he tried to charge me for that I specifically asked him not to do. I have no doubt he is good at working on more commercial projects,but to try and take advantage of  smaller projects is just not good business. I found another company I would recommend to anyone else who is looking for help, If you drive to him he will diagnose for free and walk the entire vehicle with you! It's Deitz Mobile RV. He does have a few different businesses so his response may be slow, but at least he is honest and up front about everything!

name: Charles Michael
text: Trey (owner)  was  100% accurate on his diagnosis  and repair of my 2002 Road Trek 190 P RV. His prices were more than fair and he stands  behind  his word...100%  !  I found a RV repair shop that I"ll be staying with a long time.

resp.text: Thank You Charles!

name: Sherry Peters
text: We recently had the misfortune of a car break-down near Cullman on a Saturday afternoon while returning home to St. Louis from a family vacation.  Roger with Wilson's towing was the company contacted by AAA.   I can't say enough wonderful things about him.  He not only provided more assistance in finding a place to take our car than AAA did, but he also went the extra mile by calling later in the evening to check on us, and also helped us the following day in transporting us back to the repair shop.  He was professional, courteous, and beyond helpful.  A break-down in an unfamiliar town with 4 children was much less stressful because of Roger and his helpfulness.  I would recommend Wilson's towing to anyone in need of a quality towing company with a driver you can trust.

DO NOT select this company!!  Wilson Towing  was selected by Mercedes Benz to tow my vehicle through their emergency service. Their driver tried to back into my circle driveway and he ran off BOTH sides ...greatly damaging my NEWLY planted yard!! He also scraped the tire as he loaded it onto the wrecker. Not experienced! Furthermore, although I spoke with the owner originally when it happened,  I was expecting him to call me to pay for the damage like Mercedes directed him to do.
However, I have not heard from him and it has been more than 2 weeks. NOT RECOMMENDED

name: Rumple Stiltskin
text:
Pros:
-Friendly
-Convenient
-Punctual
- received ~$40 discount for towing two vehicles at the same time.

Cons:
-Had to manually type in credit card numbers.

UPDATE 5/6/2021
Monique contacted me after posting the review. We had severe thunderstorms so she made an appointment to come out yesterday (5/5/21).
1. The tire that was flat occurred because a stump likely nudged the tire slightly off the rim and caused it to deflate. Derrick aired up the tire and it's still inflated after ~24hours.
2. Derrick and Monique also took my car to fix the fender that was pulled away from the tire and now it looks as good as new.
3. As we were talking we mentioned our dog recently got into a fight with another dog that came on to our property and it's ears was bleeding and caused a lot of flies to irritate my dog. Monique offered a suggestion as a possible solution to prevent the flies from bothering my dog. We thought we had the product she mentioned on hand, but we didn't. When Monique and Derrick took my car to fix the fender, she brought back the product she had mentioned at no charge. We later put it on our dog and it seemed to help reduce the flies irritating our dog. THANKS!

Anyways, I hope I spelt their name correctly :P

Due to the urgency they wanted to correct the error that occurred as well as help our dog. I highly recommend them.

Original Review:
- i was moving from one house to another so i paid him on pickup and let him towed the vehicle to my other house. When i got home after  i finished getting things from the house I was moving from. I noticed the car he moved had damage near the front passenger tire.  The rear passenger tire was also popped. Neither of these were there before being towed.

name: Cody Shields
text: During a six hour drive after having my oil changed at my dealership, my oil plug fell out and I lost all my oil. The insurance company contacted Precision to get me a tow. So he took us to an auto part store to get an oil plug and oil and then even replaced the oil and plug. We were on our way. His service was above and beyond that of his tow duty. It made a frustrating experience tolerable, and he should be commended. I'd recommend the company to anyone now.

text: Billy helped me out today when I had some problems with my battery on the interstate. name: Diana Bharj
text: My friend and I were on our way home from a road trip when our car started dying out, and we both became worried as we were new to the area and being both two young women we didn’t know if we would be stranded in Alabama or really what to do. Thankfully with one call to Billy’s towing services he was able to come out (even at 8 pm) after all the other towing services had closed and was able to offer his help and advice on what to do. Billy was so kind and friendly and offered to check everything with our car to make sure it was okay to drive home. Thank you so much Billy for your help and for coming at such a late hour! If you need a towing service skip the big ones and go for a more genuine business like Billy’s!

resp.text: I really appreciate that Diana, thank you. Always a pleasure. 👍🏼👍🏼

He called us and asked what was wrong with the car and then came and diagnosed the problem. Not to mention it was around 8 pm when we called. He provided excellent service and advice for our car! Thank you so much Billy for fixing our car and helping us!!

name: Barbara Yasa
text: Memorial Day weekend, Billy was my Angel, after so many others hanging up on me he was the only one to come to my rescue. I woke him up when I called and when he could not reach me back on my phone he got dressed and came to find me, he had Holiday plans himself but he stayed to help me. Had it not been for him I’m not sure how I would have gotten home, Billy went way above and beyond to help me and I am so grateful I found him. Billy my car is now fixed😁🙏🍻 Thank you

name: Ron Foster
text: I know no one ever want a car breakdown but it happens from time to time. Travelling southbound on I65, my left rear tire went flat quickly at Mile Marker 218.  With interstate traffic racing by, car heavily packed, no spare tire, and walking to the nearest exit not an option, I googled roadside assistance.  Billy Williams Towing is listed on top for a reason.  If ever a car failure in the area and roadside assistance is required, Billy is the one you want to come and help. Very quick response, friendly, and professional.

resp.text: Thanks Ron. I'm always happy to help. Stay safe out there.

name: Kristin Mullinix
text: Billy went above and beyond to help my family and I when we were in need. We were out of town, driving back from vacation. My car was overheating, so I pulled off the Jemison exit. My coolant reservoir had cracked. I wasn’t sure what we were going to do. Traffic was horrible and with it being late afternoon on a Saturday (the day before Easter), many places were closed. Billy saw our car with the hood up and came over to help. He told me which auto part store was open and gave me directions. He replaced the reservoir for me, and then triple and quadruple checked that my car was good to go before he felt safe enough for us to get back on the road. A few hours later he even texted us just to be sure we were ok and the car wasn’t getting hot again. I 100% recommend him!  He is definitely a God send and I appreciate what he did for us more than he will ever know!  Thanks again, from the bottom of my heart!

resp.text: You are very welcome! Stay safe out there and call me anytime!

name: Shayla Currie
text: I was traveling I-65 South bound with my two daughters and my tire went flat😬...and the traffic was so unforgiving! I didnt know where i was plus my spare was bad...I just knew i had just entered Chilton County...so i grabbed my phone and Google nearest tow service and Billy's Towing was the first to come up. Omg...i explained to him the last sign i remembered seeing andhe knew exactly where I was...he got to us REALLY quickly! He was fast, courteous, patient, and very kind. I was nervous and worried because I was stuck out on the interstate with my two girls but Billy made everything better..he even got my car to a tire shop that waited for us and got me a new tire on my car in no time. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY!!!

resp.text: Thank's Shayla! Glad I could help you out!

name: Debby Fischer
text: I used G an G Auto to ship my car from Sacramento to  the Trenton TX area. I paid their deposit of $150 after they first quoted $100 and quoted first $800 then $850 to do the job. My son signed the contract and then the issues started. They were supposed to pick up my car on March 26, 2021 so it could get to Trenton Tx by end of March. They never called and I had to call them. Told me the driver is running late will call in the AM of March 27, 2021. Never called and no pick up. This repeated for 2 days. No one ever called back and I always had to chase them. Finally, a supervisor called back told me they driver was AWOL, the guy John who I was dealing with was fired and now they have to find a new driver,  like that was my fault. Took them days to get back to me after I spoke to another supervisor who said she would call back and guess what… no call back. Finally, they said the had a new driver and it would cost $1400 with $150 already paid so I would have to pay the driver $1250. After my son already signed a contract for $850. When I asked for a discount for my trouble and extra cost to rent my rental car for another week they told me no. I do not know how this company has such a high rating with the BBB when they obviously extorted $400 dollars from me to get my car to Trenton TX and another $700 for the extra week of my car rental. Not to mention they never called back and were dishonest from the beginning. This company is horrible. Find a different company and do not  trust rating from the BBB.

resp.text: We apologize about this please provide me an order # since i checked and we do not have an order under Debby Fischer.

So I cancelled the service because they couldn't deliver what they promised. Then they have the nerve to change my debt card $200.00 without my authorization. I will be disputing the charge. You want to loose money and waste your time then this is the company for you.

name: justin parsons
text: ***BEWARE*** DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY.  I scheduled a pickup for 7/31 to deliver my new vehicle from FL to NC.  Adam Gomez gave me a price of $600 and said my vehicle would be picked up and possibly delivered on 7/31but delivery would be no later than 8/1.  I called Adam at 8:30 AM on 7/31 to confirm pickup.  He said he would call me back in a hour or two.  At 1:30 PM, the car lot I purchased the vehicle from calls me.  They said they have here heard from G&G.  I called Adam and he told me they do not have a driver yet.  I told him that this was poor communication and he needed to call me back with a scheduled time for pickup.  At 6 PM I call G&G back and speak with someone different who says they still do not have a driver for my vehicle.  At 8 PM I receive a text from Adam saying they have a truck for $900 that can pick my vehicle up Sunday.  This is two days later than my original quote I and $300 more.  If you do not want your time wasted, use another company.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Justin I'm sorry to hear about your bad experience with our company, We're normally known for our exceptional attention to detail, and we regret that we missed the mark. Covid-19 has drastically changed the industry; prices are changing constantly, driver are staying home, there are looting and rioting all over the states etc. If you don't mind giving me a call at (256) 464-2554 at your earliest convenience, it would be greatly appreciated. We look forward to speaking with you and working toward earning back your business.

Update: No they did not my car, because after the owner was unsympathetic and rude I advised my insurance company to cancel this company! I told my insurance company I did not trust them to touch my car. I know he meant that I was rude, but when he said "we're rude" he's right they are rude!

resp.text: We didn’t even tow your car.  We cancelled the order after you didn’t like the eta and we’re very rude.  We were honest about the other tows in front of you.  Some people just think they should be first.  Have a good evening.

name: Bee Em
text: Big thanks to Jason (a driver/mechanic) for driving nearly 2 hours to get to my vehicle only to find nothing was wrong. Not only was he patient and understanding but he was nice about the whole situation!

name: Nikhil Thomas
text:
Jimmy was an angel who helped us in every way he could. Will recommend to everyone.
Long story short:
-he helped us with a car which he was given wrong info with
-he gave us a ride along to the end destination even after he had to drop the car mid way
- he spoke to the agents to rectify the matter when things got too technical and made them understand the issue.
- he even connected with the rental to get me a car setup to continue with my journey.

I would have still been stuck in an unknown place without Jimmy.

Details:
My car rental company goofed up and had not returned the key fob of my running car to me. After driving over 100 miles when we reached a rest stop at a Cracker barrel we realized the mistake. Roadside assistance connected me with Jimmy.

I read the review of the company and was a bit weary but this guy is fantastic. I dont usually wriete reviews but this needs a shout out.

Jimmy was prompt, gave me a call, took my address and told me that I was second in line and gave me an ETA of 2 hours. Looking up Google, i saw he was around 1.15 away from me and since he already had a job ahead of me, this was fine.

He even contacted me again after he finished his prior appointment and told me he is on his way with a new ETA.

When he reached the car, Roadside assistance had given him incorrect information and my car was a 4wd and not a 2wd.

Note: We still had to head out another 1.5 hours as that was the next nearest rental we had to go to.

He still tried testing a lot as i was already waiting for 2 hours, and he finally managed to take the car in the car lift. as i had the newer version, and there was no manual, he gave us his 100% to get us on our way.

He even said, if it was someone else from his team, he would have not even asked them to drive and asked them to head back. I guess seeing our plight, and our situation he gave his everything to make this as good as it could be.

This was a ride along as well, and suddenly after 10-15 minutes on our way, he realised something was wrong (his instinct was so good, my wife and I did not feel anything on the truck) but he said something is wrong, and as soon as he opened the door, i could smell something was off. (like over heating)

The 4wd was giving issues. He had to park the car in the side as we could not go any further. he even got connected with another tow truck to help get the car to the location and told us he would take care of it.

He still got us to the car rental service and connected with the people so that they could give us a new car when this one was not with us.

All in all, in this horrid experience Jimmy and Absolute Towing were a godsend.

resp.text: Thank you so very much for your incredibly kind words.  A lot of times we're asked to take calls, that for many different reasons the customers have already been sitting for hours.  We do our very best with every customer, to treat the way we would want if we were in that situation.  Please let us know if we can be of any more help in the future.  Have a great day!

text:
Would prefer not to complain on here but I could not find another forum to do so. I’ve used AAA on and off for 20+ years. I’ve always had good service. I initiated a roadside assistance call in Vestavia at approximately 1:50 CST. The original estimated time of arrival was 2:20, then that changed to 3:45 then 4:05. Its 4:15 and still no one has shown up. Someone did finally call and say they were on the way. By the time they get here it’s going to be close to 3 hours before someone shows up. It’s going to be hard for me to pull the trigger to renew my membership if this is the kind of service I should expect going forward.
Update: 4:38 CST- still sitting here waiting

text: Very slow responses, could be much better

name: Shenequa Burks
text: Insurance is awful, I had an accident and because my car was at fault they didn't hesitate to total out my car because it was new. It took forever to get a response and when I did it was again a run around came. I cancelled my insurance policy because I found a cheaper and better quote, so I called in 08/2019 to cancel the insurance along with road side assistance. Now date all the way to 01/03/2020 $162.00 was taken out my account for road side assistance that was supposed to be cancelled in 08/2019. Let's not forget I was quoted a price of $95 dollars on a two year basic because of all the cars on the policy. I called them on the 01/3/2020 and 01/7/2020 and I'm getting the run around again I just want my money put back in my account for a membership that was cancelled last year. It takes them no time to reach in and get the money but takes 7-10 BUSINESS DAYS to give it back. Highly upset I would not recommend them to anybody.....

name: Casey Benefield
text:
Policy is what it is. Got rear ended, and it took 5 days to get a claim number. I did try to get the claim office on the phone immediately at the scene, via the 24/7 "call and report immediately" number on the back of my insurance card.

I have the audio on my dashcam for that where I kept trying, and they gave  me the runaround. Everyone I have talked to locally about this seem to not understand why, and honestly I have no idea why either. Once I got to my local branch, we got a claim number. Easy peasy. Apparently I'm the only person who has ever been told "we're just roadside."

I just hope... that now that I have someone's email and direct number, that we can get through this....

Now, on a previous claim, they had NO issue doing a claim when it was something against me.

I also wanted to ask a simple question, but unfortunately, the person answering the phone acted like a full-stop barrier. They kept on focusing on a different claim, and would not even let me speak about this one.... that I FINALLY got started/a claim number for.

I had to waste more time, drive down there to the office, to ask my question. My question had a short simple answer when I got there. It didn't have to be that complicated.

Vicki (sp?) always treated me right (within AAA's policy at least), but as a whole, AAA's insurance product just plain stinks compared to other policies I had in the past. Vicki is why I give AAA 2 stars instead of 1. I think she was trying her best.

State Farm, who I came from, even though they accused me of false odometer every year (I work from home), they at least gave me a claim number when I called, and they ultimately covered things in the end, like glass, which AAA doesn't cover at all.  I keep learning of things with AAA that are not covered, or just under-insured...

The ultimate irony is, the Missouri AAA was sitting there accusing me of the false odometer thing too... the very reason why I left State Farm. I even ended up going down to the Acton Rd office to drag someone out to the car, so they can look  for themselves. On a modern car, you can't fake the odometer reading like you can on an older car... this is a 2017.

Seems like every time I need AAA for something, even if it is simply to update phone numbers, it's unnecessarily difficult.

Trust is important, and I need to be able to trust that my insurance company will handle things without argument, in the policy, and that the policy is sufficient for incidents like this current one.

I'm frustrated, stressed out, and didn't need all that added on to the fact that a potentially uninsured motorist just rear ended me....

name: Kernel Cpt
text:
My brother visited from Texas and the ac went out on his truck. The owner said he would diagnose it and call him with the results. He even gave him a ride home. The next day no call so my brother called but no answer so he went there to see what he diagnosed. He said he hadn’t found the problem yet then offered to give my brother two vehicles and $1000 for his truck. Three days later on Saturday we went there to check on the truck and the owner said he hadn’t found the problem yet. We asked him to put the truck back together because my brother needed to get back to Texas. He said he would get it done that day so he could get us out of his hair. I’m not sure what we did to cause him to say that. He never called so my brother called but no answer. His sign says he closes at 12 on Saturday so we went there at 11. He was already closed with the gate closed. I saw someone walking between buildings so I blew the horn to get someone’s attention. A minute later the gate opened so we pulled in. Then I noticed a car pull in behind us; it was his wife. We explained to her that he said he would have the truck put back together that day so he could go back to Texas. She said he was gone and called him. He was angry that we were there and he obviously had no intention of putt the truck back together that day. His wife was nice and apologized about the whole situation and said we needed to leave before he got home. We removed his light from under the hood and snapped the fuse box back in place and left. About 30 minutes later he called my brother and called him every fowl word known to man.
Any ac mechanic worth his salt should be able to diagnose a problem in less than 4 days. I don’t know how this guy is getting reviews above a 1. The only reason he gets a 1 from me is because I can’t give a 0.

name: Amy B.
text: I have a 2001 Nissan Frontier.  I had a water leak and the people at a national auto repair chain said they couldn't help me because they would have to lift the engine out to find where the water was leaking from.  I took the truck to B&K because they have a sign out front that says they are a Nissan specialist.  He asked if I could leave the truck with him and I brought it back the next day.  Within the week they had fixed diagnosed where the leaks were and fixed them at a very reasonable charge.  I am very happy with the work done by B&K.

name: Brandon GCP
text: I would go here again in a heartbeat.  Was vacationing down on Dauphin Island when I ran into a (probably) minor car issue.  Started calling some places to see who would take a few minutes to talk to me about it.  Couldn't find "good reviews" anywhere, and was weary that I was going to get someone who recognized that I was in a bind and was going to try to take me for much more money than my problem was really going to cost.  Byron was the first one who actually answered their phone, and couldn't have been more helpful.  After listening to my issue, he even told me how I could fix it myself, seeing as I was 30 / 45 minutes away from him, and he didn't want to waste my money on a simple fix.  However, I told him as much as I appreciated that, I didn't have the proper tools, and would just like them to look at my car.  He told me to come on up, and I did.  He fixed my issue, and didn't charge me a dime more than what he quoted me on the phone before I drove up there.   A+++.  Next time I''m on Dauphin Island and I have any car trouble, there's no doubt  on where I'm going.

name: Reshunda Gilbert
text: I can't be mad that the guys did their job. My car was towed outside of my apartment yesterday (12/2/17), although I have a handicap tag (which had fallen off of the rearview mirror). I asked  Kirk the guy working if he could express to the owner the importance of having ALL of their drivers on the same page, and he in turned would not! Three weeks ago the company left a sticker on my car to say the tag WAS visible but needed to be hanging or he would tow the car the next time .  As I told Kirk, the reason it was LAYING on the dash two weeks ago was because it falls down (as it did yesterday) and having it on the dash was the best thing to do. Per Kirk,  if one driver patrols he is ok keith them on the dash but if the other one rides he will tow the car! So my question was to establish that IF THE SIGN FALLS AGAIN since I CAN'T hang it AND I CAN'T lay it on the dash of my car would my car be towed and I charged $250 ONCE AGAIN!!! Her Kirk gets smart and say a well get another tag. It's not that simple as I explained I didnt renew my tag again until next year and I am not going to pay for another tag now and again then. I am really upset that the owner has no policy in force that goes for each driver to not have this happen to people.

name: Don Coolieo
text: My car was towed from a private property while I was at work at the Huntsville Hospital. I called tow pro to verify that my car was there around 6:20pm at which the off site rep(a woman) quoted me $200. I was forced to wait until I got off at 10:00pm and arrived at tow pro at 10:30pm. Upon arrival I was met with the truck driver who was already there working. I called the off site rep to tell her of my arrival which she then charged me an additional $50 “gate fee(a fee charged to have a worker open the gate for me after hours) totaling $250. I disputed the charge informing her that a worker was already there and that there should be no need to charge me extra. I was forced to pay the $250 after being explained that they will continue to charge me day by day additional storage fees. While paying the over priced fee of $250 I asked the worked to explain to me their price point and simple inquiries about the price and regulations of towing companies, he then threatened me with addition storage fees for asking question stating that “the reason they charge so much for retrieving impounded cars is for people like me who get agitated and ask questions.” I was forced to essentially keep my mouth closed for fear of not getting my car back without having additional fees added. He did not provide me with information of their prices and refused to Itemize my receipt. I feel over charged by far and belittled having to pay for a Nonconsensual Towing fee without an explanation of prices.

resp.text: Mr. Morales car was towed from a restaurant that has very limited parking. We charge a gate fee for after hours. We don't have a point system for charges. name: Tracy Slough
text:
UPDATE: 4/28/2021
So I read their canned response that all unsatisfied reviewers get, and I followed the instructions to escalate the issue. I did receive an email, and then called the number specified (4/20/2021). I recounted my story to the customer service agent and was told I would receive a call from the person over our area within 24 to 48 hours. I’m still waiting. I haven’t heard another thing by phone or email from management. I don’t really expect to at this point. Just wanted to update so others would not think all of these issues were resolved.

I have used this location for more than 10 years to service my cars and buy tires.  They bought my loyalty by fixing a flat before I was a customer. Today, they have lost me as a customer. One of my daughters took her car in for the managers special oil change which includes a tire rotation. They did not do this service. This is the second car in a month that they did not rotate the tires when getting the oil changed. The tires for both were purchased at this store. Last month, sending my oldest daughter to get her oil changed, not only did they not rotate the tires, they tried to charge her for the high mileage synthetic oil change when she ordered the managers special when setting the appointment in the app. She only gave her information. When she picked up her car, the charge was over $60 for the upgraded service. When her father questioned why so much, they said the app doesn’t tell them which oil to use and they just have to make a judgment call. When he told them that I usually take care of this and to put in my information, they came back and apologized, issued a credit for the price difference, and gave us a free oil change. After what happened today, I no longer trust them to service my cars. I feel my daughter’s were taken advantage of and have warned them that this is what they face as young women. Also, as this is a corporate owned store, I will no longer recommend Pep Boys or trust any Pep Boys location with my vehicles.

And then they told me it would be $800 to find a genuine compressor because my car was built in Japan when it was literally built in Tennessee ( checked the vin #) and to add insult to injury I found oil in my intake box after they had my car. The oil wasn’t there before . It was FRESH OIL too. Scammers . Stay away and find another shop

name: Michael Herring
text:
I was headed to Pep Boys to get an alignment on my front end, when the engine light started to flash.

I told the tech I needed an alignment and to see if they could find out why the engine light was flashing. I know I needed spark plugs, but wanted them to see if it was anything worse.

An hour later, no alignment, and I was told I needed an engine because the number 2 cylinder wasn't getting any fire. I asked about the coil pack, wires, and plugs, but they were adament about me needing an engine.

I asked how much it would cost and the response was between $1800 to $2600.

After I left, I stopped by Advance Auto Parts and picked up plugs, coil pack, and cam sensor.

After waiting for the engine to cool, I spent about 45 minutes installing the parts. For less than $100, and now, I have no "flashing" engine light or error codes.

Anyone that lacked knowledge of how an engine works, would have spent quite a sum to fix an engine that had nothing wrong.

Needless to say, I won't ever take my vehicle to them again, for any type of service.

I just called this location to inquire about purchasing the same tires that I purchased from a different Pep Boys location in 2018 (2 years ago) happens to be the Falken ZE950. I wanted to know if they could honor the price I paid in 2018 which at that time the other location did a price match from another tire dealer to get my business. However the man that answered the phone  listen to my question and asked how much I paid and then  persisted to tell me that the entire series of that tire has been discontinued. He did offer to sell me a Starfire tire for the same price which was made by Cooper tire. After ending the call  I look on Pep Boys website, low and behold their  was the Falken ZE950. Then noticed the suggested Starfire tire he mentioned didn't even have a mileage warranty and it was actually cheaper than he was going to sell them to me. Clearly this locations business is doing so well right now they don't need any additional business.
So I called another location and they was very willing to have my business , the tire I want at the price we agreed on.
Skyland Pepboys you should be ashamed of how you treat potential customers. Very shady, non trust worthy staff. I will NEVER go to this location for anything.

text: I’m trying to figure out why I’m waiting an hour for an oil change after I made my appointment online. Maybe I’m just used to the awesome service I’ve received the past 15 years from the fantastic guys in Crisshaven Drive at Express. Unfortunately my husband has been driving my car lately and he didn’t get by there. However, I did receive my car as promised within the hour. I did feel really bad for a lady and her daughter that was told it would be an hour for two tires to be put on and she stated she had already been there longer than an hour when we arrived. I recommended she remind the manager that her car was still in the parking lot and Leland did go get her car and take it into one of the empty bays. I stood at the window and watched as my oil was being changed. I’m not sure the guy that changed my oil was very knowledgeable with tools. I’m sure I’ll know soon if he was or not. There was a lot of cell phone action going on with employees and one employee actually let the phone continue to ring up front as he went and found a charger (in the back) for his phone. I will definitely return to my safe place in Birmingham that is fast, efficient, honest and clean. I gave a four star review because Leland said it would take an hour when we arrived and we were out within an hour. But seriously you should be informed of this online when making an appointment. One thing I noticed as did the other lady and we both did not like... I have a 2019 car and when they finally came outside with my paperwork they WROTE (using a ball point pen) on the HOOD of my car. If my paint is scratched I’m going to be one mad lady! I guess I was raised that you don’t mess with other people’s property like that especially if it can damage. Noticed the guys in the back did the same thing (on the other side of my hood) when they were done. Ugh. Not ok with this new car owner. I worked hard to purchase my car and want to keep it looking nice.

name: David J Hutchins
text: Great customer service and actually backs up their work. I took my 2012 Kia Forte to a Pep Boys in Orange Beach, AL for an AC repair. After a couple of months though, the AC started to get warm again and was not working correctly. After calling the Orange Beach location, they sent me over to my local Pep Boys on Skyland and I took it there. After figuring out it needed more freon, they topped it up and added dye just in case its leaking. This was all free due to the warranty and they also changed my cabin air filter free of charge. I have zero complaints with the guys at Pep Boys, and they may be the most honest and well mannered people in the auto repair industry. Pep Boys will now be my go to shop for automotive repairs I am not able to do myself. I was hesitant due to the low rating on google, but I was pleasantly surprised.

resp.text: That's great to hear! Thank you for letting us know and we hope to see you again!

name: L A (Tute4sho)
text: I took my 2003 Honda Accord for a full diagnosis because I had an oil leak and loss of power. Once I went to pick up the car he showed me a piece of paper that had 3 codes on it, and that's it. The same exact 3 codes I got from Oreillys the day before for free. So I asked him did you look for the leak or did he check my fuel injectors he said no, he just stopped looking for stuff once he saw those codes because that's almost $1600.00. So my problem is this, I paid you to tell me what's wrong with my car, not to determine if you think it's worth fixing. I wanted a full inspection of my engine that's why I paid $90. I paid $90 for absolutely nothing.

name: Daisy Mickens
text: Took a 07 Buick Lucerne to Pepboys on Skyland Blvd in Tuscaloosa, AL to have right tie rod end and other issues with the side replaced. Before taking the car there it never hesitated to start and the battery was never drained. After 2 days there received a call that the car was ready my fiancé, my daughter and I arrived to pay for the repairs and pick up the car. Attempted to start the car but it wouldn’t crank we proceed back into the office to advise the Manager that the car wouldn’t start. He had one of his mechanics to take a handheld battery charger to the car to start it. While charging the battery he says try to crank the car and when my fiancé turned the key there was a spark and it blew the radio, charged it a little more and the car cranked. As he traveled home the car was having issues with ABS and other warning lights, he made it home and the following morning on his way to work the same issues happened and he barely made it to work when it shut down and wouldn’t start, that evening had it towed to Pepboys and they determined that the computer was not working. Now they says that he must have had someone jump the car off, yes you guys jumped it off was his response but they said they knew better than to do that. After paying 1200+ to have the initial issues repaired they said they can fix it for 300+.

resp.text: We apologize that you had a poor experience.  Please allow us to review your experience by sending us your contact info and details of your visit to pepsocial@pepboys.com and we will investigate further. Thank you.

name: Qifan Nie
text:
I was trusting this place and doing all my car maintenance there like changing oils and brake pads. Early April, I was visiting Dallas and wanna change my oil there, and my mechanic guy was saying I lost one of my wheel lug nuts. Cannot imaging I was driving 600 miles away!! And then we found out that my OEM oil drain plug has been worn out due to rude work. And one more thing is, my car's cover of oil drain was lost, and the bottom part was naked. Should I blame all these horrible things to Pepboys?

Updates: PepBoys got touch with me and reimbursed the fee that I did pay for fixing my oil drain panel. I am very satisfied with their attitude afterwards.

I told him it was the back left tire that was flat. Im not sure the purpose of this because 20 minutes later the service technician came to the lobby and asked me which tire needed to be fixed. I told him it was tge flat one of course! And he said ok just making sure. Customer service is hardly average. I didnt see the horrible reviews on this place until i was bored waiting hours in the waiting room. Im about to pull off and i really dont feel comfortable with this place. name: Jevon Reinke
text: If you hire Simpson's Collision Repair and Wrecker Service you may run into frustrating circumstances regarding storage fees. Even more so on weekends, as they are only there for limited hours on Saturday and Sunday, and then only on the third weekend of every month. They assess a full day storage fee of $25 regardless of them being present at their impound lot to release a vehicle. They also state that it is their right to charge a full day of storage if they bring your vehicle to their lot before 12 am on any day. So if they tow it at 10 pm and get to the lot at 11:00 pm, it is their right to charge your tow fee and a full day of storage for that evening, as well as a full day of storage for the next day, even if you are there the second they open. So for example, if they tow your property 6.8 miles on a Friday evening, you can expect a $150 tow fee and multiple days of storage fees, when you can't even get it on most Saturdays or Sundays. Even if they are there on a Saturday or Sunday, sometimes they don't inform their answering service. This situation happened to me, though they only charged me for 2 days of storage. They informed me of this information and these policies while indicating I was lucky, because they could have made it worse. Just understand their tow policies before you hire them to recover your vehicle. In my situation, they towed my stolen motorcycle after a thief wrecked it, subsequent to a police pursuit. This is not a scathing review, and they to the best of my knowledge did a great job towing.

I would recommend Transmatic to everyone. Excellent work by Excellent people!
